249 static long long ustime(void) {
250  struct timeval tv;
251  long long ust;
252 
253  gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
254  ust = ((long long)tv.tv_sec)*1000000;
255  ust += tv.tv_usec;
256  return ust;
257 }

259 static long long mstime(void) {
260  return ustime()/1000;
261 }

263 static void cliRefreshPrompt(void) {
264  if (config.eval_ldb) return;
265 
266  sds prompt = sdsempty();
267  if (config.hostsocket != NULL) {
268  prompt = sdscatfmt(prompt,"redis %s",config.hostsocket);
269  } else {
270  char addr[256];
271  anetFormatAddr(addr, sizeof(addr), config.hostip, config.hostport);
272  prompt = sdscatlen(prompt,addr,strlen(addr));
273  }
274 
275  /* Add [dbnum] if needed */
276  if (config.dbnum != 0)
277  prompt = sdscatfmt(prompt,"[%i]",config.dbnum);
278 
279  /* Copy the prompt in the static buffer. */
280  prompt = sdscatlen(prompt,"> ",2);
281  snprintf(config.prompt,sizeof(config.prompt),"%s",prompt);
282  sdsfree(prompt);
283 }

285 /* Return the name of the dotfile for the specified 'dotfilename'.
286  * Normally it just concatenates user $HOME to the file specified
287  * in 'dotfilename'. However if the environment varialbe 'envoverride'
288  * is set, its value is taken as the path.
289  *
290  * The function returns NULL (if the file is /dev/null or cannot be
291  * obtained for some error), or an SDS string that must be freed by
292  * the user. */
293 static sds getDotfilePath(char *envoverride, char *dotfilename) {
294  char *path = NULL;
295  sds dotPath = NULL;
296 
297  /* Check the env for a dotfile override. */
298  path = getenv(envoverride);
299  if (path != NULL && *path != '\0') {
300  if (!strcmp("/dev/null", path)) {
301  return NULL;
302  }
303 
304  /* If the env is set, return it. */
305  dotPath = sdsnew(path);
306  } else {
307  char *home = getenv("HOME");
308  if (home != NULL && *home != '\0') {
309  /* If no override is set use $HOME/<dotfilename>. */
310  dotPath = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(), "%s/%s", home, dotfilename);
311  }
312  }
313  return dotPath;
314 }
315 
316 /* URL-style percent decoding. */
317 #define isHexChar(c) (isdigit(c) || (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f'))
318 #define decodeHexChar(c) (isdigit(c) ? c - '0' : c - 'a' + 10)
319 #define decodeHex(h, l) ((decodeHexChar(h) << 4) + decodeHexChar(l))
320 
321 static sds percentDecode(const char *pe, size_t len) {
322  const char *end = pe + len;
323  sds ret = sdsempty();
324  const char *curr = pe;
325 
326  while (curr < end) {
327  if (*curr == '%') {
328  if ((end - curr) < 2) {
329  fprintf(stderr, "Incomplete URI encoding\n");
330  exit(1);
331  }
332 
333  char h = tolower(*(++curr));
334  char l = tolower(*(++curr));
335  if (!isHexChar(h) || !isHexChar(l)) {
336  fprintf(stderr, "Illegal character in URI encoding\n");
337  exit(1);
338  }
339  char c = decodeHex(h, l);
340  ret = sdscatlen(ret, &c, 1);
341  curr++;
342  } else {
343  ret = sdscatlen(ret, curr++, 1);
344  }
345  }
346 
347  return ret;
348 }
349 
350 /* Parse a URI and extract the server connection information.
351  * URI scheme is based on the the provisional specification[1] excluding support
352  * for query parameters. Valid URIs are:
353  * scheme: "redis://"
354  * authority: [<username> ":"] <password> "@"] [<hostname> [":" <port>]]
355  * path: ["/" [<db>]]
356  *
357  * [1]: https://www.iana.org/assignments/uri-schemes/prov/redis */
358 static void parseRedisUri(const char *uri) {
359 
360  const char *scheme = "redis://";
361  const char *curr = uri;
362  const char *end = uri + strlen(uri);
363  const char *userinfo, *username, *port, *host, *path;
364 
365  /* URI must start with a valid scheme. */
366  if (strncasecmp(scheme, curr, strlen(scheme))) {
367  fprintf(stderr,"Invalid URI scheme\n");
368  exit(1);
369  }
370  curr += strlen(scheme);
371  if (curr == end) return;
372 
373  /* Extract user info. */
374  if ((userinfo = strchr(curr,'@'))) {
375  if ((username = strchr(curr, ':')) && username < userinfo) {
376  /* If provided, username is ignored. */
377  curr = username + 1;
378  }
379 
380  config.auth = percentDecode(curr, userinfo - curr);
381  curr = userinfo + 1;
382  }
383  if (curr == end) return;
384 
385  /* Extract host and port. */
386  path = strchr(curr, '/');
387  if (*curr != '/') {
388  host = path ? path - 1 : end;
389  if ((port = strchr(curr, ':'))) {
390  config.hostport = atoi(port + 1);
391  host = port - 1;
392  }
393  config.hostip = sdsnewlen(curr, host - curr + 1);
394  }
395  curr = path ? path + 1 : end;
396  if (curr == end) return;
397 
398  /* Extract database number. */
399  config.dbnum = atoi(curr);
400 }

402 static uint64_t dictSdsHash(const void *key) {
403  return dictGenHashFunction((unsigned char*)key, sdslen((char*)key));

406 static int dictSdsKeyCompare(void *privdata, const void *key1,
407  const void *key2)
408 {
409  int l1,l2;
410  DICT_NOTUSED(privdata);
411 
412  l1 = sdslen((sds)key1);
413  l2 = sdslen((sds)key2);
414  if (l1 != l2) return 0;
415  return memcmp(key1, key2, l1) == 0;
416 }

441 #define CLI_HELP_COMMAND 1
442 #define CLI_HELP_GROUP 2
443 
444 typedef struct {
445  int type;
446  int argc;
447  sds *argv;
448  sds full;
449 
450  /* Only used for help on commands */
451  struct commandHelp *org;
452 } helpEntry;
453 
454 static helpEntry *helpEntries;
455 static int helpEntriesLen;
456 
457 static sds cliVersion(void) {
458  sds version;
459  version = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(), "%s", REDIS_VERSION);
460 
461  /* Add git commit and working tree status when available */
462  if (strtoll(redisGitSHA1(),NULL,16)) {
463  version = sdscatprintf(version, " (git:%s", redisGitSHA1());
464  if (strtoll(redisGitDirty(),NULL,10))
465  version = sdscatprintf(version, "-dirty");
466  version = sdscat(version, ")");
467  }
468  return version;
469 }

471 static void cliInitHelp(void) {
472  int commandslen = sizeof(commandHelp)/sizeof(struct commandHelp);
473  int groupslen = sizeof(commandGroups)/sizeof(char*);
474  int i, len, pos = 0;
475  helpEntry tmp;
476 
477  helpEntriesLen = len = commandslen+groupslen;
478  helpEntries = zmalloc(sizeof(helpEntry)*len);
479 
480  for (i = 0; i < groupslen; i++) {
481  tmp.argc = 1;
482  tmp.argv = zmalloc(sizeof(sds));
483  tmp.argv[0] = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"@%s",commandGroups[i]);
484  tmp.full = tmp.argv[0];
485  tmp.type = CLI_HELP_GROUP;
486  tmp.org = NULL;
487  helpEntries[pos++] = tmp;
488  }
489 
490  for (i = 0; i < commandslen; i++) {
491  tmp.argv = sdssplitargs(commandHelp[i].name,&tmp.argc);
492  tmp.full = sdsnew(commandHelp[i].name);
493  tmp.type = CLI_HELP_COMMAND;
494  tmp.org = &commandHelp[i];
495  helpEntries[pos++] = tmp;
496  }
497 }
498 
499 /* cliInitHelp() setups the helpEntries array with the command and group
500  * names from the help.h file. However the Redis instance we are connecting
501  * to may support more commands, so this function integrates the previous
502  * entries with additional entries obtained using the COMMAND command
503  * available in recent versions of Redis. */
504 static void cliIntegrateHelp(void) {
505  if (cliConnect(CC_QUIET) == REDIS_ERR) return;
506 
507  redisReply *reply = redisCommand(context, "COMMAND");
508  if(reply == NULL || reply->type != REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY) return;
509 
510  /* Scan the array reported by COMMAND and fill only the entries that
511  * don't already match what we have. */
512  for (size_t j = 0; j < reply->elements; j++) {
513  redisReply *entry = reply->element[j];
514  if (entry->type != REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY || entry->elements < 4 ||
515  entry->element[0]->type != REDIS_REPLY_STRING ||
516  entry->element[1]->type != REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER ||
517  entry->element[3]->type != REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER) return;
518  char *cmdname = entry->element[0]->str;
519  int i;
520 
521  for (i = 0; i < helpEntriesLen; i++) {
522  helpEntry *he = helpEntries+i;
523  if (!strcasecmp(he->argv[0],cmdname))
524  break;
525  }
526  if (i != helpEntriesLen) continue;
527 
528  helpEntriesLen++;
529  helpEntries = zrealloc(helpEntries,sizeof(helpEntry)*helpEntriesLen);
530  helpEntry *new = helpEntries+(helpEntriesLen-1);
531 
532  new->argc = 1;
533  new->argv = zmalloc(sizeof(sds));
534  new->argv[0] = sdsnew(cmdname);
535  new->full = new->argv[0];
536  new->type = CLI_HELP_COMMAND;
537  sdstoupper(new->argv[0]);
538 
539  struct commandHelp *ch = zmalloc(sizeof(*ch));
540  ch->name = new->argv[0];
541  ch->params = sdsempty();
542  int args = llabs(entry->element[1]->integer);
543  args--; /* Remove the command name itself. */
544  if (entry->element[3]->integer == 1) {
545  ch->params = sdscat(ch->params,"key ");
546  args--;
547  }
548  while(args-- > 0) ch->params = sdscat(ch->params,"arg ");
549  if (entry->element[1]->integer < 0)
550  ch->params = sdscat(ch->params,"...options...");
551  ch->summary = "Help not available";
552  ch->group = 0;
553  ch->since = "not known";
554  new->org = ch;
555  }
556  freeReplyObject(reply);
557 }
558 
559 /* Output command help to stdout. */
560 static void cliOutputCommandHelp(struct commandHelp *help, int group) {
561  printf("\r\n \x1b[1m%s\x1b[0m \x1b[90m%s\x1b[0m\r\n", help->name, help->params);
562  printf(" \x1b[33msummary:\x1b[0m %s\r\n", help->summary);
563  printf(" \x1b[33msince:\x1b[0m %s\r\n", help->since);
564  if (group) {
565  printf(" \x1b[33mgroup:\x1b[0m %s\r\n", commandGroups[help->group]);
566  }
567 }
568 
569 /* Print generic help. */
570 static void cliOutputGenericHelp(void) {
571  sds version = cliVersion();
572  printf(
573  "redis-cli %s\n"
574  "To get help about Redis commands type:\n"
575  " \"help @<group>\" to get a list of commands in <group>\n"
576  " \"help <command>\" for help on <command>\n"
577  " \"help <tab>\" to get a list of possible help topics\n"
578  " \"quit\" to exit\n"
579  "\n"
580  "To set redis-cli preferences:\n"
581  " \":set hints\" enable online hints\n"
582  " \":set nohints\" disable online hints\n"
583  "Set your preferences in ~/.redisclirc\n",
584  version
585  );
586  sdsfree(version);
587 }
588 
589 /* Output all command help, filtering by group or command name. */
590 static void cliOutputHelp(int argc, char **argv) {
591  int i, j, len;
592  int group = -1;
593  helpEntry *entry;
594  struct commandHelp *help;
595 
596  if (argc == 0) {
597  cliOutputGenericHelp();
598  return;
599  } else if (argc > 0 && argv[0][0] == '@') {
600  len = sizeof(commandGroups)/sizeof(char*);
601  for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
602  if (strcasecmp(argv[0]+1,commandGroups[i]) == 0) {
603  group = i;
604  break;
605  }
606  }
607  }
608 
609  assert(argc > 0);
610  for (i = 0; i < helpEntriesLen; i++) {
611  entry = &helpEntries[i];
612  if (entry->type != CLI_HELP_COMMAND) continue;
613 
614  help = entry->org;
615  if (group == -1) {
616  /* Compare all arguments */
617  if (argc == entry->argc) {
618  for (j = 0; j < argc; j++) {
619  if (strcasecmp(argv[j],entry->argv[j]) != 0) break;
620  }
621  if (j == argc) {
622  cliOutputCommandHelp(help,1);
623  }
624  }
625  } else {
626  if (group == help->group) {
627  cliOutputCommandHelp(help,0);
628  }
629  }
630  }
631  printf("\r\n");
632 }
633 
634 /* Linenoise completion callback. */
635 static void completionCallback(const char *buf, linenoiseCompletions *lc) {
636  size_t startpos = 0;
637  int mask;
638  int i;
639  size_t matchlen;
640  sds tmp;
641 
642  if (strncasecmp(buf,"help ",5) == 0) {
643  startpos = 5;
644  while (isspace(buf[startpos])) startpos++;
645  mask = CLI_HELP_COMMAND | CLI_HELP_GROUP;
646  } else {
647  mask = CLI_HELP_COMMAND;
648  }
649 
650  for (i = 0; i < helpEntriesLen; i++) {
651  if (!(helpEntries[i].type & mask)) continue;
652 
653  matchlen = strlen(buf+startpos);
654  if (strncasecmp(buf+startpos,helpEntries[i].full,matchlen) == 0) {
655  tmp = sdsnewlen(buf,startpos);
656  tmp = sdscat(tmp,helpEntries[i].full);
657  linenoiseAddCompletion(lc,tmp);
658  sdsfree(tmp);
659  }
660  }
661 }
662 
663 /* Linenoise hints callback. */
664 static char *hintsCallback(const char *buf, int *color, int *bold) {
665  if (!pref.hints) return NULL;
666 
667  int i, argc, buflen = strlen(buf);
668  sds *argv = sdssplitargs(buf,&argc);
669  int endspace = buflen && isspace(buf[buflen-1]);
670 
671  /* Check if the argument list is empty and return ASAP. */
672  if (argc == 0) {
673  sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
674  return NULL;
675  }
676 
677  for (i = 0; i < helpEntriesLen; i++) {
678  if (!(helpEntries[i].type & CLI_HELP_COMMAND)) continue;
679 
680  if (strcasecmp(argv[0],helpEntries[i].full) == 0)
681  {
682  *color = 90;
683  *bold = 0;
684  sds hint = sdsnew(helpEntries[i].org->params);
685 
686  /* Remove arguments from the returned hint to show only the
687  * ones the user did not yet typed. */
688  int toremove = argc-1;
689  while(toremove > 0 && sdslen(hint)) {
690  if (hint[0] == '[') break;
691  if (hint[0] == ' ') toremove--;
692  sdsrange(hint,1,-1);
693  }
694 
695  /* Add an initial space if needed. */
696  if (!endspace) {
697  sds newhint = sdsnewlen(" ",1);
698  newhint = sdscatsds(newhint,hint);
699  sdsfree(hint);
700  hint = newhint;
701  }
702 
703  sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
704  return hint;
705  }
706  }
707  sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
708  return NULL;
709 }
710 
711 static void freeHintsCallback(void *ptr) {
712  sdsfree(ptr);
713 }

719 /* Send AUTH command to the server */
720 static int cliAuth(void) {
721  redisReply *reply;
722  if (config.auth == NULL) return REDIS_OK;
723 
724  reply = redisCommand(context,"AUTH %s",config.auth);
725  if (reply != NULL) {
726  freeReplyObject(reply);
727  return REDIS_OK;
728  }
729  return REDIS_ERR;
730 }
731 
732 /* Send SELECT dbnum to the server */
733 static int cliSelect(void) {
734  redisReply *reply;
735  if (config.dbnum == 0) return REDIS_OK;
736 
737  reply = redisCommand(context,"SELECT %d",config.dbnum);
738  if (reply != NULL) {
739  int result = REDIS_OK;
740  if (reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) result = REDIS_ERR;
741  freeReplyObject(reply);
742  return result;
743  }
744  return REDIS_ERR;
745 }
746 
747 /* Connect to the server. It is possible to pass certain flags to the function:
748  * CC_FORCE: The connection is performed even if there is already
749  * a connected socket.
750  * CC_QUIET: Don't print errors if connection fails. */
751 static int cliConnect(int flags) {
752  if (context == NULL || flags & CC_FORCE) {
753  if (context != NULL) {
754  redisFree(context);
755  }
756 
757  if (config.hostsocket == NULL) {
758  context = redisConnect(config.hostip,config.hostport);
759  } else {
760  context = redisConnectUnix(config.hostsocket);
761  }
762 
763  if (context->err) {
764  if (!(flags & CC_QUIET)) {
765  fprintf(stderr,"Could not connect to Redis at ");
766  if (config.hostsocket == NULL)
767  fprintf(stderr,"%s:%d: %s\n",
768  config.hostip,config.hostport,context->errstr);
769  else
770  fprintf(stderr,"%s: %s\n",
771  config.hostsocket,context->errstr);
772  }
773  redisFree(context);
774  context = NULL;
775  return REDIS_ERR;
776  }
777 
778  /* Set aggressive KEEP_ALIVE socket option in the Redis context socket
779  * in order to prevent timeouts caused by the execution of long
780  * commands. At the same time this improves the detection of real
781  * errors. */
782  anetKeepAlive(NULL, context->fd, REDIS_CLI_KEEPALIVE_INTERVAL);
783 
784  /* Do AUTH and select the right DB. */
785  if (cliAuth() != REDIS_OK)
786  return REDIS_ERR;
787  if (cliSelect() != REDIS_OK)
788  return REDIS_ERR;
789  }
790  return REDIS_OK;
791 }
792 
793 static void cliPrintContextError(void) {
794  if (context == NULL) return;
795  fprintf(stderr,"Error: %s\n",context->errstr);
796 }
797 
798 static sds cliFormatReplyTTY(redisReply *r, char *prefix) {
799  sds out = sdsempty();
800  switch (r->type) {
801  case REDIS_REPLY_ERROR:
802  out = sdscatprintf(out,"(error) %s\n", r->str);
803  break;
804  case REDIS_REPLY_STATUS:
805  out = sdscat(out,r->str);
806  out = sdscat(out,"\n");
807  break;
808  case REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER:
809  out = sdscatprintf(out,"(integer) %lld\n",r->integer);
810  break;
811  case REDIS_REPLY_STRING:
812  /* If you are producing output for the standard output we want
813  * a more interesting output with quoted characters and so forth */
814  out = sdscatrepr(out,r->str,r->len);
815  out = sdscat(out,"\n");
816  break;
817  case REDIS_REPLY_NIL:
818  out = sdscat(out,"(nil)\n");
819  break;
820  case REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY:
821  if (r->elements == 0) {
822  out = sdscat(out,"(empty list or set)\n");
823  } else {
824  unsigned int i, idxlen = 0;
825  char _prefixlen[16];
826  char _prefixfmt[16];
827  sds _prefix;
828  sds tmp;
829 
830  /* Calculate chars needed to represent the largest index */
831  i = r->elements;
832  do {
833  idxlen++;
834  i /= 10;
835  } while(i);
836 
837  /* Prefix for nested multi bulks should grow with idxlen+2 spaces */
838  memset(_prefixlen,' ',idxlen+2);
839  _prefixlen[idxlen+2] = '\0';
840  _prefix = sdscat(sdsnew(prefix),_prefixlen);
841 
842  /* Setup prefix format for every entry */
843  snprintf(_prefixfmt,sizeof(_prefixfmt),"%%s%%%ud) ",idxlen);
844 
845  for (i = 0; i < r->elements; i++) {
846  /* Don't use the prefix for the first element, as the parent
847  * caller already prepended the index number. */
848  out = sdscatprintf(out,_prefixfmt,i == 0 ? "" : prefix,i+1);
849 
850  /* Format the multi bulk entry */
851  tmp = cliFormatReplyTTY(r->element[i],_prefix);
852  out = sdscatlen(out,tmp,sdslen(tmp));
853  sdsfree(tmp);
854  }
855  sdsfree(_prefix);
856  }
857  break;
858  default:
859  fprintf(stderr,"Unknown reply type: %d\n", r->type);
860  exit(1);
861  }
862  return out;
863 }
864 
865 int isColorTerm(void) {
866  char *t = getenv("TERM");
867  return t != NULL && strstr(t,"xterm") != NULL;
868 }
869 
870 /* Helper function for sdsCatColorizedLdbReply() appending colorize strings
871  * to an SDS string. */
872 sds sdscatcolor(sds o, char *s, size_t len, char *color) {
873  if (!isColorTerm()) return sdscatlen(o,s,len);
874 
875  int bold = strstr(color,"bold") != NULL;
876  int ccode = 37; /* Defaults to white. */
877  if (strstr(color,"red")) ccode = 31;
878  else if (strstr(color,"green")) ccode = 32;
879  else if (strstr(color,"yellow")) ccode = 33;
880  else if (strstr(color,"blue")) ccode = 34;
881  else if (strstr(color,"magenta")) ccode = 35;
882  else if (strstr(color,"cyan")) ccode = 36;
883  else if (strstr(color,"white")) ccode = 37;
884 
885  o = sdscatfmt(o,"\033[%i;%i;49m",bold,ccode);
886  o = sdscatlen(o,s,len);
887  o = sdscat(o,"\033[0m");
888  return o;
889 }
890 
891 /* Colorize Lua debugger status replies according to the prefix they
892  * have. */
893 sds sdsCatColorizedLdbReply(sds o, char *s, size_t len) {
894  char *color = "white";
895 
896  if (strstr(s,"<debug>")) color = "bold";
897  if (strstr(s,"<redis>")) color = "green";
898  if (strstr(s,"<reply>")) color = "cyan";
899  if (strstr(s,"<error>")) color = "red";
900  if (strstr(s,"<hint>")) color = "bold";
901  if (strstr(s,"<value>") || strstr(s,"<retval>")) color = "magenta";
902  if (len > 4 && isdigit(s[3])) {
903  if (s[1] == '>') color = "yellow"; /* Current line. */
904  else if (s[2] == '#') color = "bold"; /* Break point. */
905  }
906  return sdscatcolor(o,s,len,color);
907 }
908 
909 static sds cliFormatReplyRaw(redisReply *r) {
910  sds out = sdsempty(), tmp;
911  size_t i;
912 
913  switch (r->type) {
914  case REDIS_REPLY_NIL:
915  /* Nothing... */
916  break;
917  case REDIS_REPLY_ERROR:
918  out = sdscatlen(out,r->str,r->len);
919  out = sdscatlen(out,"\n",1);
920  break;
921  case REDIS_REPLY_STATUS:
922  case REDIS_REPLY_STRING:
923  if (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_STATUS && config.eval_ldb) {
924  /* The Lua debugger replies with arrays of simple (status)
925  * strings. We colorize the output for more fun if this
926  * is a debugging session. */
927 
928  /* Detect the end of a debugging session. */
929  if (strstr(r->str,"<endsession>") == r->str) {
930  config.enable_ldb_on_eval = 0;
931  config.eval_ldb = 0;
932  config.eval_ldb_end = 1; /* Signal the caller session ended. */
933  config.output = OUTPUT_STANDARD;
934  cliRefreshPrompt();
935  } else {
936  out = sdsCatColorizedLdbReply(out,r->str,r->len);
937  }
938  } else {
939  out = sdscatlen(out,r->str,r->len);
940  }
941  break;
942  case REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER:
943  out = sdscatprintf(out,"%lld",r->integer);
944  break;
945  case REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY:
946  for (i = 0; i < r->elements; i++) {
947  if (i > 0) out = sdscat(out,config.mb_delim);
948  tmp = cliFormatReplyRaw(r->element[i]);
949  out = sdscatlen(out,tmp,sdslen(tmp));
950  sdsfree(tmp);
951  }
952  break;
953  default:
954  fprintf(stderr,"Unknown reply type: %d\n", r->type);
955  exit(1);
956  }
957  return out;
958 }
959 
960 static sds cliFormatReplyCSV(redisReply *r) {
961  unsigned int i;
962 
963  sds out = sdsempty();
964  switch (r->type) {
965  case REDIS_REPLY_ERROR:
966  out = sdscat(out,"ERROR,");
967  out = sdscatrepr(out,r->str,strlen(r->str));
968  break;
969  case REDIS_REPLY_STATUS:
970  out = sdscatrepr(out,r->str,r->len);
971  break;
972  case REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER:
973  out = sdscatprintf(out,"%lld",r->integer);
974  break;
975  case REDIS_REPLY_STRING:
976  out = sdscatrepr(out,r->str,r->len);
977  break;
978  case REDIS_REPLY_NIL:
979  out = sdscat(out,"NIL");
980  break;
981  case REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY:
982  for (i = 0; i < r->elements; i++) {
983  sds tmp = cliFormatReplyCSV(r->element[i]);
984  out = sdscatlen(out,tmp,sdslen(tmp));
985  if (i != r->elements-1) out = sdscat(out,",");
986  sdsfree(tmp);
987  }
988  break;
989  default:
990  fprintf(stderr,"Unknown reply type: %d\n", r->type);
991  exit(1);
992  }
993  return out;
994 }
995 
996 static int cliReadReply(int output_raw_strings) {
997  void *_reply;
998  redisReply *reply;
999  sds out = NULL;
1000  int output = 1;
1001 
1002  if (redisGetReply(context,&_reply) != REDIS_OK) {
1003  if (config.shutdown) {
1004  redisFree(context);
1005  context = NULL;
1006  return REDIS_OK;
1007  }
1008  if (config.interactive) {
1009  /* Filter cases where we should reconnect */
1010  if (context->err == REDIS_ERR_IO &&
1011  (errno == ECONNRESET || errno == EPIPE))
1012  return REDIS_ERR;
1013  if (context->err == REDIS_ERR_EOF)
1014  return REDIS_ERR;
1015  }
1016  cliPrintContextError();
1017  exit(1);
1018  return REDIS_ERR; /* avoid compiler warning */
1019  }
1020 
1021  reply = (redisReply*)_reply;
1022 
1023  config.last_cmd_type = reply->type;
1024 
1025  /* Check if we need to connect to a different node and reissue the
1026  * request. */
1027  if (config.cluster_mode && reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR &&
1028  (!strncmp(reply->str,"MOVED",5) || !strcmp(reply->str,"ASK")))
1029  {
1030  char *p = reply->str, *s;
1031  int slot;
1032 
1033  output = 0;
1034  /* Comments show the position of the pointer as:
1035  *
1036  * [S] for pointer 's'
1037  * [P] for pointer 'p'
1038  */
1039  s = strchr(p,' '); /* MOVED[S]3999 127.0.0.1:6381 */
1040  p = strchr(s+1,' '); /* MOVED[S]3999[P]127.0.0.1:6381 */
1041  *p = '\0';
1042  slot = atoi(s+1);
1043  s = strrchr(p+1,':'); /* MOVED 3999[P]127.0.0.1[S]6381 */
1044  *s = '\0';
1045  sdsfree(config.hostip);
1046  config.hostip = sdsnew(p+1);
1047  config.hostport = atoi(s+1);
1048  if (config.interactive)
1049  printf("-> Redirected to slot [%d] located at %s:%d\n",
1050  slot, config.hostip, config.hostport);
1051  config.cluster_reissue_command = 1;
1052  cliRefreshPrompt();
1053  }
1054 
1055  if (output) {
1056  if (output_raw_strings) {
1057  out = cliFormatReplyRaw(reply);
1058  } else {
1059  if (config.output == OUTPUT_RAW) {
1060  out = cliFormatReplyRaw(reply);
1061  out = sdscat(out,"\n");
1062  } else if (config.output == OUTPUT_STANDARD) {
1063  out = cliFormatReplyTTY(reply,"");
1064  } else if (config.output == OUTPUT_CSV) {
1065  out = cliFormatReplyCSV(reply);
1066  out = sdscat(out,"\n");
1067  }
1068  }
1069  fwrite(out,sdslen(out),1,stdout);
1070  sdsfree(out);
1071  }
1072  freeReplyObject(reply);
1073  return REDIS_OK;
1074 }
1075 
1076 static int cliSendCommand(int argc, char **argv, long repeat) {
1077  char *command = argv[0];
1078  size_t *argvlen;
1079  int j, output_raw;
1080 
1081  if (!config.eval_ldb && /* In debugging mode, let's pass "help" to Redis. */
1082  (!strcasecmp(command,"help") || !strcasecmp(command,"?"))) {
1083  cliOutputHelp(--argc, ++argv);
1084  return REDIS_OK;
1085  }
1086 
1087  if (context == NULL) return REDIS_ERR;
1088 
1089  output_raw = 0;
1090  if (!strcasecmp(command,"info") ||
1091  !strcasecmp(command,"lolwut") ||
1092  (argc >= 2 && !strcasecmp(command,"debug") &&
1093  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"htstats")) ||
1094  (argc >= 2 && !strcasecmp(command,"debug") &&
1095  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"htstats-key")) ||
1096  (argc >= 2 && !strcasecmp(command,"memory") &&
1097  (!strcasecmp(argv[1],"malloc-stats") ||
1098  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"doctor"))) ||
1099  (argc == 2 && !strcasecmp(command,"cluster") &&
1100  (!strcasecmp(argv[1],"nodes") ||
1101  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"info"))) ||
1102  (argc >= 2 && !strcasecmp(command,"client") &&
1103  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"list")) ||
1104  (argc == 3 && !strcasecmp(command,"latency") &&
1105  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"graph")) ||
1106  (argc == 2 && !strcasecmp(command,"latency") &&
1107  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"doctor")))
1108  {
1109  output_raw = 1;
1110  }
1111 
1112  if (!strcasecmp(command,"shutdown")) config.shutdown = 1;
1113  if (!strcasecmp(command,"monitor")) config.monitor_mode = 1;
1114  if (!strcasecmp(command,"subscribe") ||
1115  !strcasecmp(command,"psubscribe")) config.pubsub_mode = 1;
1116  if (!strcasecmp(command,"sync") ||
1117  !strcasecmp(command,"psync")) config.slave_mode = 1;
1118 
1119  /* When the user manually calls SCRIPT DEBUG, setup the activation of
1120  * debugging mode on the next eval if needed. */
1121  if (argc == 3 && !strcasecmp(argv[0],"script") &&
1122  !strcasecmp(argv[1],"debug"))
1123  {
1124  if (!strcasecmp(argv[2],"yes") || !strcasecmp(argv[2],"sync")) {
1125  config.enable_ldb_on_eval = 1;
1126  } else {
1127  config.enable_ldb_on_eval = 0;
1128  }
1129  }
1130 
1131  /* Actually activate LDB on EVAL if needed. */
1132  if (!strcasecmp(command,"eval") && config.enable_ldb_on_eval) {
1133  config.eval_ldb = 1;
1134  config.output = OUTPUT_RAW;
1135  }
1136 
1137  /* Setup argument length */
1138  argvlen = zmalloc(argc*sizeof(size_t));
1139  for (j = 0; j < argc; j++)
1140  argvlen[j] = sdslen(argv[j]);
1141 
1142  while(repeat-- > 0) {
1143  redisAppendCommandArgv(context,argc,(const char**)argv,argvlen);
1144  while (config.monitor_mode) {
1145  if (cliReadReply(output_raw) != REDIS_OK) exit(1);
1146  fflush(stdout);
1147  }
1148 
1149  if (config.pubsub_mode) {
1150  if (config.output != OUTPUT_RAW)
1151  printf("Reading messages... (press Ctrl-C to quit)\n");
1152  while (1) {
1153  if (cliReadReply(output_raw) != REDIS_OK) exit(1);
1154  }
1155  }
1156 
1157  if (config.slave_mode) {
1158  printf("Entering replica output mode... (press Ctrl-C to quit)\n");
1159  slaveMode();
1160  config.slave_mode = 0;
1161  zfree(argvlen);
1162  return REDIS_ERR; /* Error = slaveMode lost connection to master */
1163  }
1164 
1165  if (cliReadReply(output_raw) != REDIS_OK) {
1166  zfree(argvlen);
1167  return REDIS_ERR;
1168  } else {
1169  /* Store database number when SELECT was successfully executed. */
1170  if (!strcasecmp(command,"select") && argc == 2 && config.last_cmd_type != REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
1171  config.dbnum = atoi(argv[1]);
1172  cliRefreshPrompt();
1173  } else if (!strcasecmp(command,"auth") && argc == 2) {
1174  cliSelect();
1175  }
1176  }
1177  if (config.interval) usleep(config.interval);
1178  fflush(stdout); /* Make it grep friendly */
1179  }
1180 
1181  zfree(argvlen);
1182  return REDIS_OK;
1183 }
1184 
1185 /* Send a command reconnecting the link if needed. */
1186 static redisReply *reconnectingRedisCommand(redisContext *c, const char *fmt, ...) {
1187  redisReply *reply = NULL;
1188  int tries = 0;
1189  va_list ap;
1190 
1191  assert(!c->err);
1192  while(reply == NULL) {
1193  while (c->err & (REDIS_ERR_IO | REDIS_ERR_EOF)) {
1194  printf("\r\x1b[0K"); /* Cursor to left edge + clear line. */
1195  printf("Reconnecting... %d\r", ++tries);
1196  fflush(stdout);
1197 
1198  redisFree(c);
1199  c = redisConnect(config.hostip,config.hostport);
1200  usleep(1000000);
1201  }
1202 
1203  va_start(ap,fmt);
1204  reply = redisvCommand(c,fmt,ap);
1205  va_end(ap);
1206 
1207  if (c->err && !(c->err & (REDIS_ERR_IO | REDIS_ERR_EOF))) {
1208  fprintf(stderr, "Error: %s\n", c->errstr);
1209  exit(1);
1210  } else if (tries > 0) {
1211  printf("\r\x1b[0K"); /* Cursor to left edge + clear line. */
1212  }
1213  }
1214 
1215  context = c;
1216  return reply;
1217 }

1219 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1220  * User interface
1221  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1222 
1223 static int parseOptions(int argc, char **argv) {
1224  int i;
1225 
1226  for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
1227  int lastarg = i==argc-1;
1228 
1229  if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-h") && !lastarg) {
1230  sdsfree(config.hostip);
1231  config.hostip = sdsnew(argv[++i]);
1232  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-h") && lastarg) {
1233  usage();
1234  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--help")) {
1235  usage();
1236  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-x")) {
1237  config.stdinarg = 1;
1238  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-p") && !lastarg) {
1239  config.hostport = atoi(argv[++i]);
1240  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-s") && !lastarg) {
1241  config.hostsocket = argv[++i];
1242  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-r") && !lastarg) {
1243  config.repeat = strtoll(argv[++i],NULL,10);
1244  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-i") && !lastarg) {
1245  double seconds = atof(argv[++i]);
1246  config.interval = seconds*1000000;
1247  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-n") && !lastarg) {
1248  config.dbnum = atoi(argv[++i]);
1249  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "--no-auth-warning")) {
1250  config.no_auth_warning = 1;
1251  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-a") && !lastarg) {
1252  config.auth = argv[++i];
1253  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-u") && !lastarg) {
1254  parseRedisUri(argv[++i]);
1255  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--raw")) {
1256  config.output = OUTPUT_RAW;
1257  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--no-raw")) {
1258  config.output = OUTPUT_STANDARD;
1259  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--csv")) {
1260  config.output = OUTPUT_CSV;
1261  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--latency")) {
1262  config.latency_mode = 1;
1263  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--latency-dist")) {
1264  config.latency_dist_mode = 1;
1265  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--mono")) {
1266  spectrum_palette = spectrum_palette_mono;
1267  spectrum_palette_size = spectrum_palette_mono_size;
1268  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--latency-history")) {
1269  config.latency_mode = 1;
1270  config.latency_history = 1;
1271  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--lru-test") && !lastarg) {
1272  config.lru_test_mode = 1;
1273  config.lru_test_sample_size = strtoll(argv[++i],NULL,10);
1274  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--slave")) {
1275  config.slave_mode = 1;
1276  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--replica")) {
1277  config.slave_mode = 1;
1278  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--stat")) {
1279  config.stat_mode = 1;
1280  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--scan")) {
1281  config.scan_mode = 1;
1282  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--pattern") && !lastarg) {
1283  config.pattern = argv[++i];
1284  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--intrinsic-latency") && !lastarg) {
1285  config.intrinsic_latency_mode = 1;
1286  config.intrinsic_latency_duration = atoi(argv[++i]);
1287  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--rdb") && !lastarg) {
1288  config.getrdb_mode = 1;
1289  config.rdb_filename = argv[++i];
1290  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--pipe")) {
1291  config.pipe_mode = 1;
1292  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--pipe-timeout") && !lastarg) {
1293  config.pipe_timeout = atoi(argv[++i]);
1294  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--bigkeys")) {
1295  config.bigkeys = 1;
1296  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--hotkeys")) {
1297  config.hotkeys = 1;
1298  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--eval") && !lastarg) {
1299  config.eval = argv[++i];
1300  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--ldb")) {
1301  config.eval_ldb = 1;
1302  config.output = OUTPUT_RAW;
1303  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--ldb-sync-mode")) {
1304  config.eval_ldb = 1;
1305  config.eval_ldb_sync = 1;
1306  config.output = OUTPUT_RAW;
1307  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-c")) {
1308  config.cluster_mode = 1;
1309  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-d") && !lastarg) {
1310  sdsfree(config.mb_delim);
1311  config.mb_delim = sdsnew(argv[++i]);
1312  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--verbose")) {
1313  config.verbose = 1;
1314  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster") && !lastarg) {
1315  if (CLUSTER_MANAGER_MODE()) usage();
1316  char *cmd = argv[++i];
1317  int j = i;
1318  while (j < argc && argv[j][0] != '-') j++;
1319  if (j > i) j--;
1320  createClusterManagerCommand(cmd, j - i, argv + i + 1);
1321  i = j;
1322  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster") && lastarg) {
1323  usage();
1324  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-replicas") && !lastarg) {
1325  config.cluster_manager_command.replicas = atoi(argv[++i]);
1326  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-master-id") && !lastarg) {
1327  config.cluster_manager_command.master_id = argv[++i];
1328  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-from") && !lastarg) {
1329  config.cluster_manager_command.from = argv[++i];
1330  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-to") && !lastarg) {
1331  config.cluster_manager_command.to = argv[++i];
1332  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-weight") && !lastarg) {
1333  if (config.cluster_manager_command.weight != NULL) {
1334  fprintf(stderr, "WARNING: you cannot use --cluster-weight "
1335  "more than once.\n"
1336  "You can set more weights by adding them "
1337  "as a space-separated list, ie:\n"
1338  "--cluster-weight n1=w n2=w\n");
1339  exit(1);
1340  }
1341  int widx = i + 1;
1342  char **weight = argv + widx;
1343  int wargc = 0;
1344  for (; widx < argc; widx++) {
1345  if (strstr(argv[widx], "--") == argv[widx]) break;
1346  if (strchr(argv[widx], '=') == NULL) break;
1347  wargc++;
1348  }
1349  if (wargc > 0) {
1350  config.cluster_manager_command.weight = weight;
1351  config.cluster_manager_command.weight_argc = wargc;
1352  i += wargc;
1353  }
1354  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-slots") && !lastarg) {
1355  config.cluster_manager_command.slots = atoi(argv[++i]);
1356  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-timeout") && !lastarg) {
1357  config.cluster_manager_command.timeout = atoi(argv[++i]);
1358  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-pipeline") && !lastarg) {
1359  config.cluster_manager_command.pipeline = atoi(argv[++i]);
1360  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-threshold") && !lastarg) {
1361  config.cluster_manager_command.threshold = atof(argv[++i]);
1362  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-yes")) {
1363  config.cluster_manager_command.flags |=
1364  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_YES;
1365  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-simulate")) {
1366  config.cluster_manager_command.flags |=
1367  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_SIMULATE;
1368  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-replace")) {
1369  config.cluster_manager_command.flags |=
1370  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_REPLACE;
1371  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-copy")) {
1372  config.cluster_manager_command.flags |=
1373  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_COPY;
1374  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-slave")) {
1375  config.cluster_manager_command.flags |=
1376  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_SLAVE;
1377  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"--cluster-use-empty-masters")) {
1378  config.cluster_manager_command.flags |=
1379  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_EMPTYMASTER;
1380  } else if (!strcmp(argv[i],"-v") || !strcmp(argv[i], "--version")) {
1381  sds version = cliVersion();
1382  printf("redis-cli %s\n", version);
1383  sdsfree(version);
1384  exit(0);
1385  } else if (CLUSTER_MANAGER_MODE() && argv[i][0] != '-') {
1386  if (config.cluster_manager_command.argc == 0) {
1387  int j = i + 1;
1388  while (j < argc && argv[j][0] != '-') j++;
1389  int cmd_argc = j - i;
1390  config.cluster_manager_command.argc = cmd_argc;
1391  config.cluster_manager_command.argv = argv + i;
1392  if (cmd_argc > 1) i = j - 1;
1393  }
1394  } else {
1395  if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
1396  fprintf(stderr,
1397  "Unrecognized option or bad number of args for: '%s'\n",
1398  argv[i]);
1399  exit(1);
1400  } else {
1401  /* Likely the command name, stop here. */
1402  break;
1403  }
1404  }
1405  }
1406 
1407  /* --ldb requires --eval. */
1408  if (config.eval_ldb && config.eval == NULL) {
1409  fprintf(stderr,"Options --ldb and --ldb-sync-mode require --eval.\n");
1410  fprintf(stderr,"Try %s --help for more information.\n", argv[0]);
1411  exit(1);
1412  }
1413 
1414  if (!config.no_auth_warning && config.auth != NULL) {
1415  fputs("Warning: Using a password with '-a' or '-u' option on the command"
1416  " line interface may not be safe.\n", stderr);
1417  }
1418 
1419  return i;
1420 }
1421 
1422 static sds readArgFromStdin(void) {
1423  char buf[1024];
1424  sds arg = sdsempty();
1425 
1426  while(1) {
1427  int nread = read(fileno(stdin),buf,1024);
1428 
1429  if (nread == 0) break;
1430  else if (nread == -1) {
1431  perror("Reading from standard input");
1432  exit(1);
1433  }
1434  arg = sdscatlen(arg,buf,nread);
1435  }
1436  return arg;
1437 }

1439 static void usage(void) {
1440  sds version = cliVersion();
1441  fprintf(stderr,
1442 "redis-cli %s\n"
1443 "\n"
1444 "Usage: redis-cli [OPTIONS] [cmd [arg [arg ...]]]\n"
1445 " -h <hostname> Server hostname (default: 127.0.0.1).\n"
1446 " -p <port> Server port (default: 6379).\n"
1447 " -s <socket> Server socket (overrides hostname and port).\n"
1448 " -a <password> Password to use when connecting to the server.\n"
1449 " -u <uri> Server URI.\n"
1450 " -r <repeat> Execute specified command N times.\n"
1451 " -i <interval> When -r is used, waits <interval> seconds per command.\n"
1452 " It is possible to specify sub-second times like -i 0.1.\n"
1453 " -n <db> Database number.\n"
1454 " -x Read last argument from STDIN.\n"
1455 " -d <delimiter> Multi-bulk delimiter in for raw formatting (default: \\n).\n"
1456 " -c Enable cluster mode (follow -ASK and -MOVED redirections).\n"
1457 " --raw Use raw formatting for replies (default when STDOUT is\n"
1458 " not a tty).\n"
1459 " --no-raw Force formatted output even when STDOUT is not a tty.\n"
1460 " --csv Output in CSV format.\n"
1461 " --stat Print rolling stats about server: mem, clients, ...\n"
1462 " --latency Enter a special mode continuously sampling latency.\n"
1463 " If you use this mode in an interactive session it runs\n"
1464 " forever displaying real-time stats. Otherwise if --raw or\n"
1465 " --csv is specified, or if you redirect the output to a non\n"
1466 " TTY, it samples the latency for 1 second (you can use\n"
1467 " -i to change the interval), then produces a single output\n"
1468 " and exits.\n"
1469 " --latency-history Like --latency but tracking latency changes over time.\n"
1470 " Default time interval is 15 sec. Change it using -i.\n"
1471 " --latency-dist Shows latency as a spectrum, requires xterm 256 colors.\n"
1472 " Default time interval is 1 sec. Change it using -i.\n"
1473 " --lru-test <keys> Simulate a cache workload with an 80-20 distribution.\n"
1474 " --replica Simulate a replica showing commands received from the master.\n"
1475 " --rdb <filename> Transfer an RDB dump from remote server to local file.\n"
1476 " --pipe Transfer raw Redis protocol from stdin to server.\n"
1477 " --pipe-timeout <n> In --pipe mode, abort with error if after sending all data.\n"
1478 " no reply is received within <n> seconds.\n"
1479 " Default timeout: %d. Use 0 to wait forever.\n"
1480 " --bigkeys Sample Redis keys looking for big keys.\n"
1481 " --hotkeys Sample Redis keys looking for hot keys.\n"
1482 " only works when maxmemory-policy is *lfu.\n"
1483 " --scan List all keys using the SCAN command.\n"
1484 " --pattern <pat> Useful with --scan to specify a SCAN pattern.\n"
1485 " --intrinsic-latency <sec> Run a test to measure intrinsic system latency.\n"
1486 " The test will run for the specified amount of seconds.\n"
1487 " --eval <file> Send an EVAL command using the Lua script at <file>.\n"
1488 " --ldb Used with --eval enable the Redis Lua debugger.\n"
1489 " --ldb-sync-mode Like --ldb but uses the synchronous Lua debugger, in\n"
1490 " this mode the server is blocked and script changes are\n"
1491 " not rolled back from the server memory.\n"
1492 " --cluster <command> [args...] [opts...]\n"
1493 " Cluster Manager command and arguments (see below).\n"
1494 " --verbose Verbose mode.\n"
1495 " --no-auth-warning Don't show warning message when using password on command\n"
1496 " line interface.\n"
1497 " --help Output this help and exit.\n"
1498 " --version Output version and exit.\n"
1499 "\n",
1500  version, REDIS_CLI_DEFAULT_PIPE_TIMEOUT);
1501  /* Using another fprintf call to avoid -Woverlength-strings compile warning */
1502  fprintf(stderr,
1503 "Cluster Manager Commands:\n"
1504 " Use --cluster help to list all available cluster manager commands.\n"
1505 "\n"
1506 "Examples:\n"
1507 " cat /etc/passwd | redis-cli -x set mypasswd\n"
1508 " redis-cli get mypasswd\n"
1509 " redis-cli -r 100 lpush mylist x\n"
1510 " redis-cli -r 100 -i 1 info | grep used_memory_human:\n"
1511 " redis-cli --eval myscript.lua key1 key2 , arg1 arg2 arg3\n"
1512 " redis-cli --scan --pattern '*:12345*'\n"
1513 "\n"
1514 " (Note: when using --eval the comma separates KEYS[] from ARGV[] items)\n"
1515 "\n"
1516 "When no command is given, redis-cli starts in interactive mode.\n"
1517 "Type \"help\" in interactive mode for information on available commands\n"
1518 "and settings.\n"
1519 "\n");
1520  sdsfree(version);
1521  exit(1);
1522 }

1524 static int confirmWithYes(char *msg) {
1525  printf("%s (type 'yes' to accept): ", msg);
1526  fflush(stdout);
1527  char buf[4];
1528  int nread = read(fileno(stdin),buf,4);
1529  buf[3] = '\0';
1530  return (nread != 0 && !strcmp("yes", buf));
1531 }

1533 /* Turn the plain C strings into Sds strings */
1534 static char **convertToSds(int count, char** args) {
1535  int j;
1536  char **sds = zmalloc(sizeof(char*)*count);
1537 
1538  for(j = 0; j < count; j++)
1539  sds[j] = sdsnew(args[j]);
1540 
1541  return sds;
1542 }
1543 
1544 static int issueCommandRepeat(int argc, char **argv, long repeat) {
1545  while (1) {
1546  config.cluster_reissue_command = 0;
1547  if (cliSendCommand(argc,argv,repeat) != REDIS_OK) {
1548  cliConnect(CC_FORCE);
1549 
1550  /* If we still cannot send the command print error.
1551  * We'll try to reconnect the next time. */
1552  if (cliSendCommand(argc,argv,repeat) != REDIS_OK) {
1553  cliPrintContextError();
1554  return REDIS_ERR;
1555  }
1556  }
1557  /* Issue the command again if we got redirected in cluster mode */
1558  if (config.cluster_mode && config.cluster_reissue_command) {
1559  cliConnect(CC_FORCE);
1560  } else {
1561  break;
1562  }
1563  }
1564  return REDIS_OK;
1565 }
1566 
1567 static int issueCommand(int argc, char **argv) {
1568  return issueCommandRepeat(argc, argv, config.repeat);
1569 }
1570 
1571 /* Split the user provided command into multiple SDS arguments.
1572  * This function normally uses sdssplitargs() from sds.c which is able
1573  * to understand "quoted strings", escapes and so forth. However when
1574  * we are in Lua debugging mode and the "eval" command is used, we want
1575  * the remaining Lua script (after "e " or "eval ") to be passed verbatim
1576  * as a single big argument. */
1577 static sds *cliSplitArgs(char *line, int *argc) {
1578  if (config.eval_ldb && (strstr(line,"eval ") == line ||
1579  strstr(line,"e ") == line))
1580  {
1581  sds *argv = sds_malloc(sizeof(sds)*2);
1582  *argc = 2;
1583  int len = strlen(line);
1584  int elen = line[1] == ' ' ? 2 : 5; /* "e " or "eval "? */
1585  argv[0] = sdsnewlen(line,elen-1);
1586  argv[1] = sdsnewlen(line+elen,len-elen);
1587  return argv;
1588  } else {
1589  return sdssplitargs(line,argc);
1590  }
1591 }
1592 
1593 /* Set the CLI preferences. This function is invoked when an interactive
1594  * ":command" is called, or when reading ~/.redisclirc file, in order to
1595  * set user preferences. */
1596 void cliSetPreferences(char **argv, int argc, int interactive) {
1597  if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],":set") && argc >= 2) {
1598  if (!strcasecmp(argv[1],"hints")) pref.hints = 1;
1599  else if (!strcasecmp(argv[1],"nohints")) pref.hints = 0;
1600  else {
1601  printf("%sunknown redis-cli preference '%s'\n",
1602  interactive ? "" : ".redisclirc: ",
1603  argv[1]);
1604  }
1605  } else {
1606  printf("%sunknown redis-cli internal command '%s'\n",
1607  interactive ? "" : ".redisclirc: ",
1608  argv[0]);
1609  }
1610 }
1611 
1612 /* Load the ~/.redisclirc file if any. */
1613 void cliLoadPreferences(void) {
1614  sds rcfile = getDotfilePath(REDIS_CLI_RCFILE_ENV,REDIS_CLI_RCFILE_DEFAULT);
1615  if (rcfile == NULL) return;
1616  FILE *fp = fopen(rcfile,"r");
1617  char buf[1024];
1618 
1619  if (fp) {
1620  while(fgets(buf,sizeof(buf),fp) != NULL) {
1621  sds *argv;
1622  int argc;
1623 
1624  argv = sdssplitargs(buf,&argc);
1625  if (argc > 0) cliSetPreferences(argv,argc,0);
1626  sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
1627  }
1628  fclose(fp);
1629  }
1630  sdsfree(rcfile);
1631 }
1632 
1633 static void repl(void) {
1634  sds historyfile = NULL;
1635  int history = 0;
1636  char *line;
1637  int argc;
1638  sds *argv;
1639 
1640  /* Initialize the help and, if possible, use the COMMAND command in order
1641  * to retrieve missing entries. */
1642  cliInitHelp();
1643  cliIntegrateHelp();
1644 
1645  config.interactive = 1;
1646  linenoiseSetMultiLine(1);
1647  linenoiseSetCompletionCallback(completionCallback);
1648  linenoiseSetHintsCallback(hintsCallback);
1649  linenoiseSetFreeHintsCallback(freeHintsCallback);
1650 
1651  /* Only use history and load the rc file when stdin is a tty. */
1652  if (isatty(fileno(stdin))) {
1653  historyfile = getDotfilePath(REDIS_CLI_HISTFILE_ENV,REDIS_CLI_HISTFILE_DEFAULT);
1654  //keep in-memory history always regardless if history file can be determined
1655  history = 1;
1656  if (historyfile != NULL) {
1657  linenoiseHistoryLoad(historyfile);
1658  }
1659  cliLoadPreferences();
1660  }
1661 
1662  cliRefreshPrompt();
1663  while((line = linenoise(context ? config.prompt : "not connected> ")) != NULL) {
1664  if (line[0] != '\0') {
1665  long repeat = 1;
1666  int skipargs = 0;
1667  char *endptr = NULL;
1668 
1669  argv = cliSplitArgs(line,&argc);
1670 
1671  /* check if we have a repeat command option and
1672  * need to skip the first arg */
1673  if (argv && argc > 0) {
1674  errno = 0;
1675  repeat = strtol(argv[0], &endptr, 10);
1676  if (argc > 1 && *endptr == '\0') {
1677  if (errno == ERANGE || errno == EINVAL || repeat <= 0) {
1678  fputs("Invalid redis-cli repeat command option value.\n", stdout);
1679  sdsfreesplitres(argv, argc);
1680  linenoiseFree(line);
1681  continue;
1682  }
1683  skipargs = 1;
1684  } else {
1685  repeat = 1;
1686  }
1687  }
1688 
1689  /* Won't save auth command in history file */
1690  if (!(argv && argc > 0 && !strcasecmp(argv[0+skipargs], "auth"))) {
1691  if (history) linenoiseHistoryAdd(line);
1692  if (historyfile) linenoiseHistorySave(historyfile);
1693  }
1694 
1695  if (argv == NULL) {
1696  printf("Invalid argument(s)\n");
1697  linenoiseFree(line);
1698  continue;
1699  } else if (argc > 0) {
1700  if (strcasecmp(argv[0],"quit") == 0 ||
1701  strcasecmp(argv[0],"exit") == 0)
1702  {
1703  exit(0);
1704  } else if (argv[0][0] == ':') {
1705  cliSetPreferences(argv,argc,1);
1706  sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
1707  linenoiseFree(line);
1708  continue;
1709  } else if (strcasecmp(argv[0],"restart") == 0) {
1710  if (config.eval) {
1711  config.eval_ldb = 1;
1712  config.output = OUTPUT_RAW;
1713  return; /* Return to evalMode to restart the session. */
1714  } else {
1715  printf("Use 'restart' only in Lua debugging mode.");
1716  }
1717  } else if (argc == 3 && !strcasecmp(argv[0],"connect")) {
1718  sdsfree(config.hostip);
1719  config.hostip = sdsnew(argv[1]);
1720  config.hostport = atoi(argv[2]);
1721  cliRefreshPrompt();
1722  cliConnect(CC_FORCE);
1723  } else if (argc == 1 && !strcasecmp(argv[0],"clear")) {
1724  linenoiseClearScreen();
1725  } else {
1726  long long start_time = mstime(), elapsed;
1727 
1728  issueCommandRepeat(argc-skipargs, argv+skipargs, repeat);
1729 
1730  /* If our debugging session ended, show the EVAL final
1731  * reply. */
1732  if (config.eval_ldb_end) {
1733  config.eval_ldb_end = 0;
1734  cliReadReply(0);
1735  printf("\n(Lua debugging session ended%s)\n\n",
1736  config.eval_ldb_sync ? "" :
1737  " -- dataset changes rolled back");
1738  }
1739 
1740  elapsed = mstime()-start_time;
1741  if (elapsed >= 500 &&
1742  config.output == OUTPUT_STANDARD)
1743  {
1744  printf("(%.2fs)\n",(double)elapsed/1000);
1745  }
1746  }
1747  }
1748  /* Free the argument vector */
1749  sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
1750  }
1751  /* linenoise() returns malloc-ed lines like readline() */
1752  linenoiseFree(line);
1753  }
1754  exit(0);
1755 }
1756 
1757 static int noninteractive(int argc, char **argv) {
1758  int retval = 0;
1759  if (config.stdinarg) {
1760  argv = zrealloc(argv, (argc+1)*sizeof(char*));
1761  argv[argc] = readArgFromStdin();
1762  retval = issueCommand(argc+1, argv);
1763  } else {
1764  retval = issueCommand(argc, argv);
1765  }
1766  return retval;
1767 }
1768 
1769 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1770  * Eval mode
1771  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1772 
1773 static int evalMode(int argc, char **argv) {
1774  sds script = NULL;
1775  FILE *fp;
1776  char buf[1024];
1777  size_t nread;
1778  char **argv2;
1779  int j, got_comma, keys;
1780  int retval = REDIS_OK;
1781 
1782  while(1) {
1783  if (config.eval_ldb) {
1784  printf(
1785  "Lua debugging session started, please use:\n"
1786  "quit -- End the session.\n"
1787  "restart -- Restart the script in debug mode again.\n"
1788  "help -- Show Lua script debugging commands.\n\n"
1789  );
1790  }
1791 
1792  sdsfree(script);
1793  script = sdsempty();
1794  got_comma = 0;
1795  keys = 0;
1796 
1797  /* Load the script from the file, as an sds string. */
1798  fp = fopen(config.eval,"r");
1799  if (!fp) {
1800  fprintf(stderr,
1801  "Can't open file '%s': %s\n", config.eval, strerror(errno));
1802  exit(1);
1803  }
1804  while((nread = fread(buf,1,sizeof(buf),fp)) != 0) {
1805  script = sdscatlen(script,buf,nread);
1806  }
1807  fclose(fp);
1808 
1809  /* If we are debugging a script, enable the Lua debugger. */
1810  if (config.eval_ldb) {
1811  redisReply *reply = redisCommand(context,
1812  config.eval_ldb_sync ?
1813  "SCRIPT DEBUG sync": "SCRIPT DEBUG yes");
1814  if (reply) freeReplyObject(reply);
1815  }
1816 
1817  /* Create our argument vector */
1818  argv2 = zmalloc(sizeof(sds)*(argc+3));
1819  argv2[0] = sdsnew("EVAL");
1820  argv2[1] = script;
1821  for (j = 0; j < argc; j++) {
1822  if (!got_comma && argv[j][0] == ',' && argv[j][1] == 0) {
1823  got_comma = 1;
1824  continue;
1825  }
1826  argv2[j+3-got_comma] = sdsnew(argv[j]);
1827  if (!got_comma) keys++;
1828  }
1829  argv2[2] = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"%d",keys);
1830 
1831  /* Call it */
1832  int eval_ldb = config.eval_ldb; /* Save it, may be reverteed. */
1833  retval = issueCommand(argc+3-got_comma, argv2);
1834  if (eval_ldb) {
1835  if (!config.eval_ldb) {
1836  /* If the debugging session ended immediately, there was an
1837  * error compiling the script. Show it and don't enter
1838  * the REPL at all. */
1839  printf("Eval debugging session can't start:\n");
1840  cliReadReply(0);
1841  break; /* Return to the caller. */
1842  } else {
1843  strncpy(config.prompt,"lua debugger> ",sizeof(config.prompt));
1844  repl();
1845  /* Restart the session if repl() returned. */
1846  cliConnect(CC_FORCE);
1847  printf("\n");
1848  }
1849  } else {
1850  break; /* Return to the caller. */
1851  }
1852  }
1853  return retval;
1854 }

2011 static clusterManagerCommandProc *validateClusterManagerCommand(void) {
2012  int i, commands_count = sizeof(clusterManagerCommands) /
2013  sizeof(clusterManagerCommandDef);
2014  clusterManagerCommandProc *proc = NULL;
2015  char *cmdname = config.cluster_manager_command.name;
2016  int argc = config.cluster_manager_command.argc;
2017  for (i = 0; i < commands_count; i++) {
2018  clusterManagerCommandDef cmddef = clusterManagerCommands[i];
2019  if (!strcmp(cmddef.name, cmdname)) {
2020  if ((cmddef.arity > 0 && argc != cmddef.arity) ||
2021  (cmddef.arity < 0 && argc < (cmddef.arity * -1))) {
2022  fprintf(stderr, "[ERR] Wrong number of arguments for "
2023  "specified --cluster sub command\n");
2024  return NULL;
2025  }
2026  proc = cmddef.proc;
2027  }
2028  }
2029  if (!proc) fprintf(stderr, "Unknown --cluster subcommand\n");
2030  return proc;
2031 }
2032 
2033 /* Get host ip and port from command arguments. If only one argument has
2034  * been provided it must be in the form of 'ip:port', elsewhere
2035  * the first argument must be the ip and the second one the port.
2036  * If host and port can be detected, it returns 1 and it stores host and
2037  * port into variables referenced by'ip_ptr' and 'port_ptr' pointers,
2038  * elsewhere it returns 0. */
2039 static int getClusterHostFromCmdArgs(int argc, char **argv,
2040  char **ip_ptr, int *port_ptr) {
2041  int port = 0;
2042  char *ip = NULL;
2043  if (argc == 1) {
2044  char *addr = argv[0];
2045  char *c = strrchr(addr, '@');
2046  if (c != NULL) *c = '\0';
2047  c = strrchr(addr, ':');
2048  if (c != NULL) {
2049  *c = '\0';
2050  ip = addr;
2051  port = atoi(++c);
2052  } else return 0;
2053  } else {
2054  ip = argv[0];
2055  port = atoi(argv[1]);
2056  }
2057  if (!ip || !port) return 0;
2058  else {
2059  *ip_ptr = ip;
2060  *port_ptr = port;
2061  }
2062  return 1;
2063 }

2065 static void freeClusterManagerNodeFlags(list *flags) {
2066  listIter li;
2067  listNode *ln;
2068  listRewind(flags, &li);
2069  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2070  sds flag = ln->value;
2071  sdsfree(flag);
2072  }
2073  listRelease(flags);
2074 }

2076 static void freeClusterManagerNode(clusterManagerNode *node) {
2077  if (node->context != NULL) redisFree(node->context);
2078  if (node->friends != NULL) {
2079  listIter li;
2080  listNode *ln;
2081  listRewind(node->friends,&li);
2082  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2083  clusterManagerNode *fn = ln->value;
2084  freeClusterManagerNode(fn);
2085  }
2086  listRelease(node->friends);
2087  node->friends = NULL;
2088  }
2089  if (node->name != NULL) sdsfree(node->name);
2090  if (node->replicate != NULL) sdsfree(node->replicate);
2091  if ((node->flags & CLUSTER_MANAGER_FLAG_FRIEND) && node->ip)
2092  sdsfree(node->ip);
2093  int i;
2094  if (node->migrating != NULL) {
2095  for (i = 0; i < node->migrating_count; i++) sdsfree(node->migrating[i]);
2096  zfree(node->migrating);
2097  }
2098  if (node->importing != NULL) {
2099  for (i = 0; i < node->importing_count; i++) sdsfree(node->importing[i]);
2100  zfree(node->importing);
2101  }
2102  if (node->flags_str != NULL) {
2103  freeClusterManagerNodeFlags(node->flags_str);
2104  node->flags_str = NULL;
2105  }
2106  zfree(node);
2107 }

2109 static void freeClusterManager(void) {
2110  listIter li;
2111  listNode *ln;
2112  if (cluster_manager.nodes != NULL) {
2113  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes,&li);
2114  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2115  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
2116  freeClusterManagerNode(n);
2117  }
2118  listRelease(cluster_manager.nodes);
2119  cluster_manager.nodes = NULL;
2120  }
2121  if (cluster_manager.errors != NULL) {
2122  listRewind(cluster_manager.errors,&li);
2123  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2124  sds err = ln->value;
2125  sdsfree(err);
2126  }
2127  listRelease(cluster_manager.errors);
2128  cluster_manager.errors = NULL;
2129  }
2130  if (clusterManagerUncoveredSlots != NULL)
2131  dictRelease(clusterManagerUncoveredSlots);
2132 }

2159 /* Check whether reply is NULL or its type is REDIS_REPLY_ERROR. In the
2160  * latest case, if the 'err' arg is not NULL, it gets allocated with a copy
2161  * of reply error (it's up to the caller function to free it), elsewhere
2162  * the error is directly printed. */
2163 static int clusterManagerCheckRedisReply(clusterManagerNode *n,
2164  redisReply *r, char **err)
2165 {
2166  int is_err = 0;
2167  if (!r || (is_err = (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR))) {
2168  if (is_err) {
2169  if (err != NULL) {
2170  *err = zmalloc((r->len + 1) * sizeof(char));
2171  strcpy(*err, r->str);
2172  } else CLUSTER_MANAGER_PRINT_REPLY_ERROR(n, r->str);
2173  }
2174  return 0;
2175  }
2176  return 1;
2177 }
2178 
2179 static int clusterManagerNodeConnect(clusterManagerNode *node) {
2180  if (node->context) redisFree(node->context);
2181  node->context = redisConnect(node->ip, node->port);
2182  if (node->context->err) {
2183  fprintf(stderr,"Could not connect to Redis at ");
2184  fprintf(stderr,"%s:%d: %s\n", node->ip, node->port,
2185  node->context->errstr);
2186  redisFree(node->context);
2187  node->context = NULL;
2188  return 0;
2189  }
2190  /* Set aggressive KEEP_ALIVE socket option in the Redis context socket
2191  * in order to prevent timeouts caused by the execution of long
2192  * commands. At the same time this improves the detection of real
2193  * errors. */
2194  anetKeepAlive(NULL, node->context->fd, REDIS_CLI_KEEPALIVE_INTERVAL);
2195  if (config.auth) {
2196  redisReply *reply = redisCommand(node->context,"AUTH %s",config.auth);
2197  int ok = clusterManagerCheckRedisReply(node, reply, NULL);
2198  if (reply != NULL) freeReplyObject(reply);
2199  if (!ok) return 0;
2200  }
2201  return 1;
2202 }

2204 static void clusterManagerRemoveNodeFromList(list *nodelist,
2205  clusterManagerNode *node) {
2206  listIter li;
2207  listNode *ln;
2208  listRewind(nodelist, &li);
2209  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2210  if (node == ln->value) {
2211  listDelNode(nodelist, ln);
2212  break;
2213  }
2214  }
2215 }

2217 /* Return the node with the specified name (ID) or NULL. */
2218 static clusterManagerNode *clusterManagerNodeByName(const char *name) {
2219  if (cluster_manager.nodes == NULL) return NULL;
2220  clusterManagerNode *found = NULL;
2221  sds lcname = sdsempty();
2222  lcname = sdscpy(lcname, name);
2223  sdstolower(lcname);
2224  listIter li;
2225  listNode *ln;
2226  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
2227  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2228  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
2229  if (n->name && !sdscmp(n->name, lcname)) {
2230  found = n;
2231  break;
2232  }
2233  }
2234  sdsfree(lcname);
2235  return found;
2236 }

2238 /* Like clusterManagerNodeByName but the specified name can be just the first
2239  * part of the node ID as long as the prefix in unique across the
2240  * cluster.
2241  */
2242 static clusterManagerNode *clusterManagerNodeByAbbreviatedName(const char*name)
2243 {
2244  if (cluster_manager.nodes == NULL) return NULL;
2245  clusterManagerNode *found = NULL;
2246  sds lcname = sdsempty();
2247  lcname = sdscpy(lcname, name);
2248  sdstolower(lcname);
2249  listIter li;
2250  listNode *ln;
2251  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
2252  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2253  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
2254  if (n->name &&
2255  strstr(n->name, lcname) == n->name) {
2256  found = n;
2257  break;
2258  }
2259  }
2260  sdsfree(lcname);
2261  return found;
2262 }

2295 /* Checks whether the node is empty. Node is considered not-empty if it has
2296  * some key or if it already knows other nodes */
2297 static int clusterManagerNodeIsEmpty(clusterManagerNode *node, char **err) {
2298  redisReply *info = clusterManagerGetNodeRedisInfo(node, err);
2299  int is_empty = 1;
2300  if (info == NULL) return 0;
2301  if (strstr(info->str, "db0:") != NULL) {
2302  is_empty = 0;
2303  goto result;
2304  }
2305  freeReplyObject(info);
2306  info = CLUSTER_MANAGER_COMMAND(node, "CLUSTER INFO");
2307  if (err != NULL) *err = NULL;
2308  if (!clusterManagerCheckRedisReply(node, info, err)) {
2309  is_empty = 0;
2310  goto result;
2311  }
2312  long known_nodes = getLongInfoField(info->str, "cluster_known_nodes");
2313  is_empty = (known_nodes == 1);
2314 result:
2315  freeReplyObject(info);
2316  return is_empty;
2317 }
2318 
2319 /* Return the anti-affinity score, which is a measure of the amount of
2320  * violations of anti-affinity in the current cluster layout, that is, how
2321  * badly the masters and slaves are distributed in the different IP
2322  * addresses so that slaves of the same master are not in the master
2323  * host and are also in different hosts.
2324  *
2325  * The score is calculated as follows:
2326  *
2327  * SAME_AS_MASTER = 10000 * each slave in the same IP of its master.
2328  * SAME_AS_SLAVE = 1 * each slave having the same IP as another slave
2329  of the same master.
2330  * FINAL_SCORE = SAME_AS_MASTER + SAME_AS_SLAVE
2331  *
2332  * So a greater score means a worse anti-affinity level, while zero
2333  * means perfect anti-affinity.
2334  *
2335  * The anti affinity optimizator will try to get a score as low as
2336  * possible. Since we do not want to sacrifice the fact that slaves should
2337  * not be in the same host as the master, we assign 10000 times the score
2338  * to this violation, so that we'll optimize for the second factor only
2339  * if it does not impact the first one.
2340  *
2341  * The ipnodes argument is an array of clusterManagerNodeArray, one for
2342  * each IP, while ip_count is the total number of IPs in the configuration.
2343  *
2344  * The function returns the above score, and the list of
2345  * offending slaves can be stored into the 'offending' argument,
2346  * so that the optimizer can try changing the configuration of the
2347  * slaves violating the anti-affinity goals. */
2348 static int clusterManagerGetAntiAffinityScore(clusterManagerNodeArray *ipnodes,
2349  int ip_count, clusterManagerNode ***offending, int *offending_len)
2350 {
2351  int score = 0, i, j;
2352  int node_len = cluster_manager.nodes->len;
2353  clusterManagerNode **offending_p = NULL;
2354  if (offending != NULL) {
2355  *offending = zcalloc(node_len * sizeof(clusterManagerNode*));
2356  offending_p = *offending;
2357  }
2358  /* For each set of nodes in the same host, split by
2359  * related nodes (masters and slaves which are involved in
2360  * replication of each other) */
2361  for (i = 0; i < ip_count; i++) {
2362  clusterManagerNodeArray *node_array = &(ipnodes[i]);
2363  dict *related = dictCreate(&clusterManagerDictType, NULL);
2364  char *ip = NULL;
2365  for (j = 0; j < node_array->len; j++) {
2366  clusterManagerNode *node = node_array->nodes[j];
2367  if (node == NULL) continue;
2368  if (!ip) ip = node->ip;
2369  sds types, otypes;
2370  // We always use the Master ID as key
2371  sds key = (!node->replicate ? node->name : node->replicate);
2372  assert(key != NULL);
2373  dictEntry *entry = dictFind(related, key);
2374  if (entry) otypes = (sds) dictGetVal(entry);
2375  else {
2376  otypes = sdsempty();
2377  dictAdd(related, key, otypes);
2378  }
2379  // Master type 'm' is always set as the first character of the
2380  // types string.
2381  if (!node->replicate) types = sdscatprintf(otypes, "m%s", otypes);
2382  else types = sdscat(otypes, "s");
2383  if (types != otypes) dictReplace(related, key, types);
2384  }
2385  /* Now it's trivial to check, for each related group having the
2386  * same host, what is their local score. */
2387  dictIterator *iter = dictGetIterator(related);
2388  dictEntry *entry;
2389  while ((entry = dictNext(iter)) != NULL) {
2390  sds types = (sds) dictGetVal(entry);
2391  sds name = (sds) dictGetKey(entry);
2392  int typeslen = sdslen(types);
2393  if (typeslen < 2) continue;
2394  if (types[0] == 'm') score += (10000 * (typeslen - 1));
2395  else score += (1 * typeslen);
2396  if (offending == NULL) continue;
2397  /* Populate the list of offending nodes. */
2398  listIter li;
2399  listNode *ln;
2400  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
2401  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2402  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
2403  if (n->replicate == NULL) continue;
2404  if (!strcmp(n->replicate, name) && !strcmp(n->ip, ip)) {
2405  *(offending_p++) = n;
2406  if (offending_len != NULL) (*offending_len)++;
2407  break;
2408  }
2409  }
2410  }
2411  //if (offending_len != NULL) *offending_len = offending_p - *offending;
2412  dictReleaseIterator(iter);
2413  dictRelease(related);
2414  }
2415  return score;
2416 }
2417 
2418 static void clusterManagerOptimizeAntiAffinity(clusterManagerNodeArray *ipnodes,
2419  int ip_count)
2420 {
2421  clusterManagerNode **offenders = NULL;
2422  int score = clusterManagerGetAntiAffinityScore(ipnodes, ip_count,
2423  NULL, NULL);
2424  if (score == 0) goto cleanup;
2425  clusterManagerLogInfo(">>> Trying to optimize slaves allocation "
2426  "for anti-affinity\n");
2427  int node_len = cluster_manager.nodes->len;
2428  int maxiter = 500 * node_len; // Effort is proportional to cluster size...
2429  srand(time(NULL));
2430  while (maxiter > 0) {
2431  int offending_len = 0;
2432  if (offenders != NULL) {
2433  zfree(offenders);
2434  offenders = NULL;
2435  }
2436  score = clusterManagerGetAntiAffinityScore(ipnodes,
2437  ip_count,
2438  &offenders,
2439  &offending_len);
2440  if (score == 0) break; // Optimal anti affinity reached
2441  /* We'll try to randomly swap a slave's assigned master causing
2442  * an affinity problem with another random slave, to see if we
2443  * can improve the affinity. */
2444  int rand_idx = rand() % offending_len;
2445  clusterManagerNode *first = offenders[rand_idx],
2446  *second = NULL;
2447  clusterManagerNode **other_replicas = zcalloc((node_len - 1) *
2448  sizeof(*other_replicas));
2449  int other_replicas_count = 0;
2450  listIter li;
2451  listNode *ln;
2452  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
2453  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2454  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
2455  if (n != first && n->replicate != NULL)
2456  other_replicas[other_replicas_count++] = n;
2457  }
2458  if (other_replicas_count == 0) {
2459  zfree(other_replicas);
2460  break;
2461  }
2462  rand_idx = rand() % other_replicas_count;
2463  second = other_replicas[rand_idx];
2464  char *first_master = first->replicate,
2465  *second_master = second->replicate;
2466  first->replicate = second_master, first->dirty = 1;
2467  second->replicate = first_master, second->dirty = 1;
2468  int new_score = clusterManagerGetAntiAffinityScore(ipnodes,
2469  ip_count,
2470  NULL, NULL);
2471  /* If the change actually makes thing worse, revert. Otherwise
2472  * leave as it is because the best solution may need a few
2473  * combined swaps. */
2474  if (new_score > score) {
2475  first->replicate = first_master;
2476  second->replicate = second_master;
2477  }
2478  zfree(other_replicas);
2479  maxiter--;
2480  }
2481  score = clusterManagerGetAntiAffinityScore(ipnodes, ip_count, NULL, NULL);
2482  char *msg;
2483  int perfect = (score == 0);
2484  int log_level = (perfect ? CLUSTER_MANAGER_LOG_LVL_SUCCESS :
2485  CLUSTER_MANAGER_LOG_LVL_WARN);
2486  if (perfect) msg = "[OK] Perfect anti-affinity obtained!";
2487  else if (score >= 10000)
2488  msg = ("[WARNING] Some slaves are in the same host as their master");
2489  else
2490  msg=("[WARNING] Some slaves of the same master are in the same host");
2491  clusterManagerLog(log_level, "%s\n", msg);
2492 cleanup:
2493  zfree(offenders);
2494 }
2495 
2496 /* Return a representable string of the node's flags */
2497 static sds clusterManagerNodeFlagString(clusterManagerNode *node) {
2498  sds flags = sdsempty();
2499  if (!node->flags_str) return flags;
2500  int empty = 1;
2501  listIter li;
2502  listNode *ln;
2503  listRewind(node->flags_str, &li);
2504  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2505  sds flag = ln->value;
2506  if (strcmp(flag, "myself") == 0) continue;
2507  if (!empty) flags = sdscat(flags, ",");
2508  flags = sdscatfmt(flags, "%S", flag);
2509  empty = 0;
2510  }
2511  return flags;
2512 }
2513 
2514 /* Return a representable string of the node's slots */
2515 static sds clusterManagerNodeSlotsString(clusterManagerNode *node) {
2516  sds slots = sdsempty();
2517  int first_range_idx = -1, last_slot_idx = -1, i;
2518  for (i = 0; i < CLUSTER_MANAGER_SLOTS; i++) {
2519  int has_slot = node->slots[i];
2520  if (has_slot) {
2521  if (first_range_idx == -1) {
2522  if (sdslen(slots)) slots = sdscat(slots, ",");
2523  first_range_idx = i;
2524  slots = sdscatfmt(slots, "[%u", i);
2525  }
2526  last_slot_idx = i;
2527  } else {
2528  if (last_slot_idx >= 0) {
2529  if (first_range_idx == last_slot_idx)
2530  slots = sdscat(slots, "]");
2531  else slots = sdscatfmt(slots, "-%u]", last_slot_idx);
2532  }
2533  last_slot_idx = -1;
2534  first_range_idx = -1;
2535  }
2536  }
2537  if (last_slot_idx >= 0) {
2538  if (first_range_idx == last_slot_idx) slots = sdscat(slots, "]");
2539  else slots = sdscatfmt(slots, "-%u]", last_slot_idx);
2540  }
2541  return slots;
2542 }
2543 
2544 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2545  * Key space handling
2546  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2547 
2548 /* We have 16384 hash slots. The hash slot of a given key is obtained
2549  * as the least significant 14 bits of the crc16 of the key.
2550  *
2551  * However if the key contains the {...} pattern, only the part between
2552  * { and } is hashed. This may be useful in the future to force certain
2553  * keys to be in the same node (assuming no resharding is in progress). */
2554 static unsigned int clusterManagerKeyHashSlot(char *key, int keylen) {
2555  int s, e; /* start-end indexes of { and } */
2556 
2557  for (s = 0; s < keylen; s++)
2558  if (key[s] == '{') break;
2559 
2560  /* No '{' ? Hash the whole key. This is the base case. */
2561  if (s == keylen) return crc16(key,keylen) & 0x3FFF;
2562 
2563  /* '{' found? Check if we have the corresponding '}'. */
2564  for (e = s+1; e < keylen; e++)
2565  if (key[e] == '}') break;
2566 
2567  /* No '}' or nothing between {} ? Hash the whole key. */
2568  if (e == keylen || e == s+1) return crc16(key,keylen) & 0x3FFF;
2569 
2570  /* If we are here there is both a { and a } on its right. Hash
2571  * what is in the middle between { and }. */
2572  return crc16(key+s+1,e-s-1) & 0x3FFF;
2573 }
2574 
2575 /* Return a string representation of the cluster node. */
2576 static sds clusterManagerNodeInfo(clusterManagerNode *node, int indent) {
2577  sds info = sdsempty();
2578  sds spaces = sdsempty();
2579  int i;
2580  for (i = 0; i < indent; i++) spaces = sdscat(spaces, " ");
2581  if (indent) info = sdscat(info, spaces);
2582  int is_master = !(node->flags & CLUSTER_MANAGER_FLAG_SLAVE);
2583  char *role = (is_master ? "M" : "S");
2584  sds slots = NULL;
2585  if (node->dirty && node->replicate != NULL)
2586  info = sdscatfmt(info, "S: %S %s:%u", node->name, node->ip, node->port);
2587  else {
2588  slots = clusterManagerNodeSlotsString(node);
2589  sds flags = clusterManagerNodeFlagString(node);
2590  info = sdscatfmt(info, "%s: %S %s:%u\n"
2591  "%s slots:%S (%u slots) "
2592  "%S",
2593  role, node->name, node->ip, node->port, spaces,
2594  slots, node->slots_count, flags);
2595  sdsfree(slots);
2596  sdsfree(flags);
2597  }
2598  if (node->replicate != NULL)
2599  info = sdscatfmt(info, "\n%s replicates %S", spaces, node->replicate);
2600  else if (node->replicas_count)
2601  info = sdscatfmt(info, "\n%s %U additional replica(s)",
2602  spaces, node->replicas_count);
2603  sdsfree(spaces);
2604  return info;
2605 }

2607 static void clusterManagerShowNodes(void) {
2608  listIter li;
2609  listNode *ln;
2610  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
2611  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
2612  clusterManagerNode *node = ln->value;
2613  sds info = clusterManagerNodeInfo(node, 0);
2614  printf("%s\n", (char *) info);
2615  sdsfree(info);
2616  }
2617 }
