4873 static int clusterManagerCommandRebalance(int argc, char **argv) {
4874  int port = 0;
4875  char *ip = NULL;
4876  clusterManagerNode **weightedNodes = NULL;
4877  list *involved = NULL;
4878  if (!getClusterHostFromCmdArgs(argc, argv, &ip, &port)) goto invalid_args;
4879  clusterManagerNode *node = clusterManagerNewNode(ip, port);
4880  if (!clusterManagerLoadInfoFromNode(node, 0)) return 0;
4881  int result = 1, i;
4882  if (config.cluster_manager_command.weight != NULL) {
4883  for (i = 0; i < config.cluster_manager_command.weight_argc; i++) {
4884  char *name = config.cluster_manager_command.weight[i];
4885  char *p = strchr(name, '=');
4886  if (p == NULL) {
4887  result = 0;
4888  goto cleanup;
4889  }
4890  *p = '\0';
4891  float w = atof(++p);
4892  clusterManagerNode *n = clusterManagerNodeByAbbreviatedName(name);
4893  if (n == NULL) {
4894  clusterManagerLogErr("*** No such master node %s\n", name);
4895  result = 0;
4896  goto cleanup;
4897  }
4898  n->weight = w;
4899  }
4900  }
4901  float total_weight = 0;
4902  int nodes_involved = 0;
4903  int use_empty = config.cluster_manager_command.flags &
4904  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_EMPTYMASTER;
4905  involved = listCreate();
4906  listIter li;
4907  listNode *ln;
4908  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
4909  /* Compute the total cluster weight. */
4910  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
4911  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
4912  if (n->flags & CLUSTER_MANAGER_FLAG_SLAVE || n->replicate)
4913  continue;
4914  if (!use_empty && n->slots_count == 0) {
4915  n->weight = 0;
4916  continue;
4917  }
4918  total_weight += n->weight;
4919  nodes_involved++;
4920  listAddNodeTail(involved, n);
4921  }
4922  weightedNodes = zmalloc(nodes_involved * sizeof(clusterManagerNode *));
4923  if (weightedNodes == NULL) goto cleanup;
4924  /* Check cluster, only proceed if it looks sane. */
4925  clusterManagerCheckCluster(1);
4926  if (cluster_manager.errors && listLength(cluster_manager.errors) > 0) {
4927  clusterManagerLogErr("*** Please fix your cluster problems "
4928  "before rebalancing\n");
4929  result = 0;
4930  goto cleanup;
4931  }
4932  /* Calculate the slots balance for each node. It's the number of
4933  * slots the node should lose (if positive) or gain (if negative)
4934  * in order to be balanced. */
4935  int threshold_reached = 0, total_balance = 0;
4936  float threshold = config.cluster_manager_command.threshold;
4937  i = 0;
4938  listRewind(involved, &li);
4939  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
4940  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
4941  weightedNodes[i++] = n;
4942  int expected = (int) (((float)CLUSTER_MANAGER_SLOTS / total_weight) *
4943  n->weight);
4944  n->balance = n->slots_count - expected;
4945  total_balance += n->balance;
4946  /* Compute the percentage of difference between the
4947  * expected number of slots and the real one, to see
4948  * if it's over the threshold specified by the user. */
4949  int over_threshold = 0;
4950  if (threshold > 0) {
4951  if (n->slots_count > 0) {
4952  float err_perc = fabs((100-(100.0*expected/n->slots_count)));
4953  if (err_perc > threshold) over_threshold = 1;
4954  } else if (expected > 1) {
4955  over_threshold = 1;
4956  }
4957  }
4958  if (over_threshold) threshold_reached = 1;
4959  }
4960  if (!threshold_reached) {
4961  clusterManagerLogWarn("*** No rebalancing needed! "
4962  "All nodes are within the %.2f%% threshold.\n",
4963  config.cluster_manager_command.threshold);
4964  goto cleanup;
4965  }
4966  /* Because of rounding, it is possible that the balance of all nodes
4967  * summed does not give 0. Make sure that nodes that have to provide
4968  * slots are always matched by nodes receiving slots. */
4969  while (total_balance > 0) {
4970  listRewind(involved, &li);
4971  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
4972  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
4973  if (n->balance <= 0 && total_balance > 0) {
4974  n->balance--;
4975  total_balance--;
4976  }
4977  }
4978  }
4979  /* Sort nodes by their slots balance. */
4980  qsort(weightedNodes, nodes_involved, sizeof(clusterManagerNode *),
4981  clusterManagerCompareNodeBalance);
4982  clusterManagerLogInfo(">>> Rebalancing across %d nodes. "
4983  "Total weight = %.2f\n",
4984  nodes_involved, total_weight);
4985  if (config.verbose) {
4986  for (i = 0; i < nodes_involved; i++) {
4987  clusterManagerNode *n = weightedNodes[i];
4988  printf("%s:%d balance is %d slots\n", n->ip, n->port, n->balance);
4989  }
4990  }
4991  /* Now we have at the start of the 'sn' array nodes that should get
4992  * slots, at the end nodes that must give slots.
4993  * We take two indexes, one at the start, and one at the end,
4994  * incrementing or decrementing the indexes accordingly til we
4995  * find nodes that need to get/provide slots. */
4996  int dst_idx = 0;
4997  int src_idx = nodes_involved - 1;
4998  int simulate = config.cluster_manager_command.flags &
4999  CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_SIMULATE;
5000  while (dst_idx < src_idx) {
5001  clusterManagerNode *dst = weightedNodes[dst_idx];
5002  clusterManagerNode *src = weightedNodes[src_idx];
5003  int db = abs(dst->balance);
5004  int sb = abs(src->balance);
5005  int numslots = (db < sb ? db : sb);
5006  if (numslots > 0) {
5007  printf("Moving %d slots from %s:%d to %s:%d\n", numslots,
5008  src->ip,
5009  src->port,
5010  dst->ip,
5011  dst->port);
5012  /* Actually move the slots. */
5013  list *lsrc = listCreate(), *table = NULL;
5014  listAddNodeTail(lsrc, src);
5015  table = clusterManagerComputeReshardTable(lsrc, numslots);
5016  listRelease(lsrc);
5017  int table_len = (int) listLength(table);
5018  if (!table || table_len != numslots) {
5019  clusterManagerLogErr("*** Assertion failed: Reshard table "
5020  "!= number of slots");
5021  result = 0;
5022  goto end_move;
5023  }
5024  if (simulate) {
5025  for (i = 0; i < table_len; i++) printf("#");
5026  } else {
5027  int opts = CLUSTER_MANAGER_OPT_QUIET |
5028  CLUSTER_MANAGER_OPT_UPDATE;
5029  listRewind(table, &li);
5030  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
5031  clusterManagerReshardTableItem *item = ln->value;
5032  result = clusterManagerMoveSlot(item->source,
5033  dst,
5034  item->slot,
5035  opts, NULL);
5036  if (!result) goto end_move;
5037  printf("#");
5038  fflush(stdout);
5039  }
5040 
5041  }
5042  printf("\n");
5043 end_move:
5044  clusterManagerReleaseReshardTable(table);
5045  if (!result) goto cleanup;
5046  }
5047  /* Update nodes balance. */
5048  dst->balance += numslots;
5049  src->balance -= numslots;
5050  if (dst->balance == 0) dst_idx++;
5051  if (src->balance == 0) src_idx --;
5052  }
5053 cleanup:
5054  if (involved != NULL) listRelease(involved);
5055  if (weightedNodes != NULL) zfree(weightedNodes);
5056  return result;
5057 invalid_args:
5058  fprintf(stderr, CLUSTER_MANAGER_INVALID_HOST_ARG);
5059  return 0;
5060 }
5061 
5062 static int clusterManagerCommandSetTimeout(int argc, char **argv) {
5063  UNUSED(argc);
5064  int port = 0;
5065  char *ip = NULL;
5066  if (!getClusterHostFromCmdArgs(1, argv, &ip, &port)) goto invalid_args;
5067  int timeout = atoi(argv[1]);
5068  if (timeout < 100) {
5069  fprintf(stderr, "Setting a node timeout of less than 100 "
5070  "milliseconds is a bad idea.\n");
5071  return 0;
5072  }
5073  // Load cluster information
5074  clusterManagerNode *node = clusterManagerNewNode(ip, port);
5075  if (!clusterManagerLoadInfoFromNode(node, 0)) return 0;
5076  int ok_count = 0, err_count = 0;
5077 
5078  clusterManagerLogInfo(">>> Reconfiguring node timeout in every "
5079  "cluster node...\n");
5080  listIter li;
5081  listNode *ln;
5082  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
5083  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
5084  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
5085  char *err = NULL;
5086  redisReply *reply = CLUSTER_MANAGER_COMMAND(n, "CONFIG %s %s %d",
5087  "SET",
5088  "cluster-node-timeout",
5089  timeout);
5090  if (reply == NULL) goto reply_err;
5091  int ok = clusterManagerCheckRedisReply(n, reply, &err);
5092  freeReplyObject(reply);
5093  if (!ok) goto reply_err;
5094  reply = CLUSTER_MANAGER_COMMAND(n, "CONFIG %s", "REWRITE");
5095  if (reply == NULL) goto reply_err;
5096  ok = clusterManagerCheckRedisReply(n, reply, &err);
5097  freeReplyObject(reply);
5098  if (!ok) goto reply_err;
5099  clusterManagerLogWarn("*** New timeout set for %s:%d\n", n->ip,
5100  n->port);
5101  ok_count++;
5102  continue;
5103 reply_err:
5104  if (err == NULL) err = "";
5105  clusterManagerLogErr("ERR setting node-timeot for %s:%d: %s\n", n->ip,
5106  n->port, err);
5107  err_count++;
5108  }
5109  clusterManagerLogInfo(">>> New node timeout set. %d OK, %d ERR.\n",
5110  ok_count, err_count);
5111  return 1;
5112 invalid_args:
5113  fprintf(stderr, CLUSTER_MANAGER_INVALID_HOST_ARG);
5114  return 0;
5115 }
5116 
5117 static int clusterManagerCommandImport(int argc, char **argv) {
5118  int success = 1;
5119  int port = 0, src_port = 0;
5120  char *ip = NULL, *src_ip = NULL;
5121  char *invalid_args_msg = NULL;
5122  if (!getClusterHostFromCmdArgs(argc, argv, &ip, &port)) {
5123  invalid_args_msg = CLUSTER_MANAGER_INVALID_HOST_ARG;
5124  goto invalid_args;
5125  }
5126  if (config.cluster_manager_command.from == NULL) {
5127  invalid_args_msg = "[ERR] Option '--cluster-from' is required for "
5128  "subcommand 'import'.\n";
5129  goto invalid_args;
5130  }
5131  char *src_host[] = {config.cluster_manager_command.from};
5132  if (!getClusterHostFromCmdArgs(1, src_host, &src_ip, &src_port)) {
5133  invalid_args_msg = "[ERR] Invalid --cluster-from host. You need to "
5134  "pass a valid address (ie. 120.0.0.1:7000).\n";
5135  goto invalid_args;
5136  }
5137  clusterManagerLogInfo(">>> Importing data from %s:%d to cluster %s:%d\n",
5138  src_ip, src_port, ip, port);
5139 
5140  clusterManagerNode *refnode = clusterManagerNewNode(ip, port);
5141  if (!clusterManagerLoadInfoFromNode(refnode, 0)) return 0;
5142  if (!clusterManagerCheckCluster(0)) return 0;
5143  char *reply_err = NULL;
5144  redisReply *src_reply = NULL;
5145  // Connect to the source node.
5146  redisContext *src_ctx = redisConnect(src_ip, src_port);
5147  if (src_ctx->err) {
5148  success = 0;
5149  fprintf(stderr,"Could not connect to Redis at %s:%d: %s.\n", src_ip,
5150  src_port, src_ctx->errstr);
5151  goto cleanup;
5152  }
5153  src_reply = reconnectingRedisCommand(src_ctx, "INFO");
5154  if (!src_reply || src_reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
5155  if (src_reply && src_reply->str) reply_err = src_reply->str;
5156  success = 0;
5157  goto cleanup;
5158  }
5159  if (getLongInfoField(src_reply->str, "cluster_enabled")) {
5160  clusterManagerLogErr("[ERR] The source node should not be a "
5161  "cluster node.\n");
5162  success = 0;
5163  goto cleanup;
5164  }
5165  freeReplyObject(src_reply);
5166  src_reply = reconnectingRedisCommand(src_ctx, "DBSIZE");
5167  if (!src_reply || src_reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
5168  if (src_reply && src_reply->str) reply_err = src_reply->str;
5169  success = 0;
5170  goto cleanup;
5171  }
5172  int size = src_reply->integer, i;
5173  clusterManagerLogWarn("*** Importing %d keys from DB 0\n", size);
5174 
5175  // Build a slot -> node map
5176  clusterManagerNode *slots_map[CLUSTER_MANAGER_SLOTS];
5177  memset(slots_map, 0, sizeof(slots_map));
5178  listIter li;
5179  listNode *ln;
5180  for (i = 0; i < CLUSTER_MANAGER_SLOTS; i++) {
5181  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
5182  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
5183  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
5184  if (n->flags & CLUSTER_MANAGER_FLAG_SLAVE) continue;
5185  if (n->slots_count == 0) continue;
5186  if (n->slots[i]) {
5187  slots_map[i] = n;
5188  break;
5189  }
5190  }
5191  }
5192 
5193  char cmdfmt[50] = "MIGRATE %s %d %s %d %d";
5194  if (config.cluster_manager_command.flags & CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_COPY)
5195  strcat(cmdfmt, " %s");
5196  if (config.cluster_manager_command.flags & CLUSTER_MANAGER_CMD_FLAG_REPLACE)
5197  strcat(cmdfmt, " %s");
5198 
5199  /* Use SCAN to iterate over the keys, migrating to the
5200  * right node as needed. */
5201  int cursor = -999, timeout = config.cluster_manager_command.timeout;
5202  while (cursor != 0) {
5203  if (cursor < 0) cursor = 0;
5204  freeReplyObject(src_reply);
5205  src_reply = reconnectingRedisCommand(src_ctx, "SCAN %d COUNT %d",
5206  cursor, 1000);
5207  if (!src_reply || src_reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
5208  if (src_reply && src_reply->str) reply_err = src_reply->str;
5209  success = 0;
5210  goto cleanup;
5211  }
5212  assert(src_reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY);
5213  assert(src_reply->elements >= 2);
5214  assert(src_reply->element[1]->type == REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY);
5215  if (src_reply->element[0]->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING)
5216  cursor = atoi(src_reply->element[0]->str);
5217  else if (src_reply->element[0]->type == REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER)
5218  cursor = src_reply->element[0]->integer;
5219  int keycount = src_reply->element[1]->elements;
5220  for (i = 0; i < keycount; i++) {
5221  redisReply *kr = src_reply->element[1]->element[i];
5222  assert(kr->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING);
5223  char *key = kr->str;
5224  uint16_t slot = clusterManagerKeyHashSlot(key, kr->len);
5225  clusterManagerNode *target = slots_map[slot];
5226  printf("Migrating %s to %s:%d: ", key, target->ip, target->port);
5227  redisReply *r = reconnectingRedisCommand(src_ctx, cmdfmt,
5228  target->ip, target->port,
5229  key, 0, timeout,
5230  "COPY", "REPLACE");
5231  if (!r || r->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
5232  if (r && r->str) {
5233  clusterManagerLogErr("Source %s:%d replied with "
5234  "error:\n%s\n", src_ip, src_port,
5235  r->str);
5236  }
5237  success = 0;
5238  }
5239  freeReplyObject(r);
5240  if (!success) goto cleanup;
5241  clusterManagerLogOk("OK\n");
5242  }
5243  }
5244 cleanup:
5245  if (reply_err)
5246  clusterManagerLogErr("Source %s:%d replied with error:\n%s\n",
5247  src_ip, src_port, reply_err);
5248  if (src_ctx) redisFree(src_ctx);
5249  if (src_reply) freeReplyObject(src_reply);
5250  return success;
5251 invalid_args:
5252  fprintf(stderr, "%s", invalid_args_msg);
5253  return 0;
5254 }
5255 
5256 static int clusterManagerCommandCall(int argc, char **argv) {
5257  int port = 0, i;
5258  char *ip = NULL;
5259  if (!getClusterHostFromCmdArgs(1, argv, &ip, &port)) goto invalid_args;
5260  clusterManagerNode *refnode = clusterManagerNewNode(ip, port);
5261  if (!clusterManagerLoadInfoFromNode(refnode, 0)) return 0;
5262  argc--;
5263  argv++;
5264  size_t *argvlen = zmalloc(argc*sizeof(size_t));
5265  clusterManagerLogInfo(">>> Calling");
5266  for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
5267  argvlen[i] = strlen(argv[i]);
5268  printf(" %s", argv[i]);
5269  }
5270  printf("\n");
5271  listIter li;
5272  listNode *ln;
5273  listRewind(cluster_manager.nodes, &li);
5274  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
5275  clusterManagerNode *n = ln->value;
5276  if (!n->context && !clusterManagerNodeConnect(n)) continue;
5277  redisReply *reply = NULL;
5278  redisAppendCommandArgv(n->context, argc, (const char **) argv, argvlen);
5279  int status = redisGetReply(n->context, (void **)(&reply));
5280  if (status != REDIS_OK || reply == NULL )
5281  printf("%s:%d: Failed!\n", n->ip, n->port);
5282  else {
5283  sds formatted_reply = cliFormatReplyTTY(reply, "");
5284  printf("%s:%d: %s\n", n->ip, n->port, (char *) formatted_reply);
5285  sdsfree(formatted_reply);
5286  }
5287  if (reply != NULL) freeReplyObject(reply);
5288  }
5289  zfree(argvlen);
5290  return 1;
5291 invalid_args:
5292  fprintf(stderr, CLUSTER_MANAGER_INVALID_HOST_ARG);
5293  return 0;
5294 }

5340 static void latencyModePrint(long long min, long long max, double avg, long long count) {
5341  if (config.output == OUTPUT_STANDARD) {
5342  printf("min: %lld, max: %lld, avg: %.2f (%lld samples)",
5343  min, max, avg, count);
5344  fflush(stdout);
5345  } else if (config.output == OUTPUT_CSV) {
5346  printf("%lld,%lld,%.2f,%lld\n", min, max, avg, count);
5347  } else if (config.output == OUTPUT_RAW) {
5348  printf("%lld %lld %.2f %lld\n", min, max, avg, count);
5349  }
5350 }
5351 
5352 #define LATENCY_SAMPLE_RATE 10 /* milliseconds. */
5353 #define LATENCY_HISTORY_DEFAULT_INTERVAL 15000 /* milliseconds. */
5354 static void latencyMode(void) {
5355  redisReply *reply;
5356  long long start, latency, min = 0, max = 0, tot = 0, count = 0;
5357  long long history_interval =
5358  config.interval ? config.interval/1000 :
5359  LATENCY_HISTORY_DEFAULT_INTERVAL;
5360  double avg;
5361  long long history_start = mstime();
5362 
5363  /* Set a default for the interval in case of --latency option
5364  * with --raw, --csv or when it is redirected to non tty. */
5365  if (config.interval == 0) {
5366  config.interval = 1000;
5367  } else {
5368  config.interval /= 1000; /* We need to convert to milliseconds. */
5369  }
5370 
5371  if (!context) exit(1);
5372  while(1) {
5373  start = mstime();
5374  reply = reconnectingRedisCommand(context,"PING");
5375  if (reply == NULL) {
5376  fprintf(stderr,"\nI/O error\n");
5377  exit(1);
5378  }
5379  latency = mstime()-start;
5380  freeReplyObject(reply);
5381  count++;
5382  if (count == 1) {
5383  min = max = tot = latency;
5384  avg = (double) latency;
5385  } else {
5386  if (latency < min) min = latency;
5387  if (latency > max) max = latency;
5388  tot += latency;
5389  avg = (double) tot/count;
5390  }
5391 
5392  if (config.output == OUTPUT_STANDARD) {
5393  printf("\x1b[0G\x1b[2K"); /* Clear the line. */
5394  latencyModePrint(min,max,avg,count);
5395  } else {
5396  if (config.latency_history) {
5397  latencyModePrint(min,max,avg,count);
5398  } else if (mstime()-history_start > config.interval) {
5399  latencyModePrint(min,max,avg,count);
5400  exit(0);
5401  }
5402  }
5403 
5404  if (config.latency_history && mstime()-history_start > history_interval)
5405  {
5406  printf(" -- %.2f seconds range\n", (float)(mstime()-history_start)/1000);
5407  history_start = mstime();
5408  min = max = tot = count = 0;
5409  }
5410  usleep(LATENCY_SAMPLE_RATE * 1000);
5411  }
5412 }
5413 
5414 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5415  * Latency distribution mode -- requires 256 colors xterm
5416  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5417 
5418 #define LATENCY_DIST_DEFAULT_INTERVAL 1000 /* milliseconds. */
5419 
5420 /* Structure to store samples distribution. */
5421 struct distsamples {
5422  long long max; /* Max latency to fit into this interval (usec). */
5423  long long count; /* Number of samples in this interval. */
5424  int character; /* Associated character in visualization. */
5425 };
5426 
5427 /* Helper function for latencyDistMode(). Performs the spectrum visualization
5428  * of the collected samples targeting an xterm 256 terminal.
5429  *
5430  * Takes an array of distsamples structures, ordered from smaller to bigger
5431  * 'max' value. Last sample max must be 0, to mean that it olds all the
5432  * samples greater than the previous one, and is also the stop sentinel.
5433  *
5434  * "tot' is the total number of samples in the different buckets, so it
5435  * is the SUM(samples[i].conut) for i to 0 up to the max sample.
5436  *
5437  * As a side effect the function sets all the buckets count to 0. */
5438 void showLatencyDistSamples(struct distsamples *samples, long long tot) {
5439  int j;
5440 
5441  /* We convert samples into a index inside the palette
5442  * proportional to the percentage a given bucket represents.
5443  * This way intensity of the different parts of the spectrum
5444  * don't change relative to the number of requests, which avoids to
5445  * pollute the visualization with non-latency related info. */
5446  printf("\033[38;5;0m"); /* Set foreground color to black. */
5447  for (j = 0; ; j++) {
5448  int coloridx =
5449  ceil((float) samples[j].count / tot * (spectrum_palette_size-1));
5450  int color = spectrum_palette[coloridx];
5451  printf("\033[48;5;%dm%c", (int)color, samples[j].character);
5452  samples[j].count = 0;
5453  if (samples[j].max == 0) break; /* Last sample. */
5454  }
5455  printf("\033[0m\n");
5456  fflush(stdout);
5457 }
5458 
5459 /* Show the legend: different buckets values and colors meaning, so
5460  * that the spectrum is more easily readable. */
5461 void showLatencyDistLegend(void) {
5462  int j;
5463 
5464  printf("---------------------------------------------\n");
5465  printf(". - * # .01 .125 .25 .5 milliseconds\n");
5466  printf("1,2,3,...,9 from 1 to 9 milliseconds\n");
5467  printf("A,B,C,D,E 10,20,30,40,50 milliseconds\n");
5468  printf("F,G,H,I,J .1,.2,.3,.4,.5 seconds\n");
5469  printf("K,L,M,N,O,P,Q,? 1,2,4,8,16,30,60,>60 seconds\n");
5470  printf("From 0 to 100%%: ");
5471  for (j = 0; j < spectrum_palette_size; j++) {
5472  printf("\033[48;5;%dm ", spectrum_palette[j]);
5473  }
5474  printf("\033[0m\n");
5475  printf("---------------------------------------------\n");
5476 }

5478 static void latencyDistMode(void) {
5479  redisReply *reply;
5480  long long start, latency, count = 0;
5481  long long history_interval =
5482  config.interval ? config.interval/1000 :
5483  LATENCY_DIST_DEFAULT_INTERVAL;
5484  long long history_start = ustime();
5485  int j, outputs = 0;
5486 
5487  struct distsamples samples[] = {
5488  /* We use a mostly logarithmic scale, with certain linear intervals
5489  * which are more interesting than others, like 1-10 milliseconds
5490  * range. */
5491  {10,0,'.'}, /* 0.01 ms */
5492  {125,0,'-'}, /* 0.125 ms */
5493  {250,0,'*'}, /* 0.25 ms */
5494  {500,0,'#'}, /* 0.5 ms */
5495  {1000,0,'1'}, /* 1 ms */
5496  {2000,0,'2'}, /* 2 ms */
5497  {3000,0,'3'}, /* 3 ms */
5498  {4000,0,'4'}, /* 4 ms */
5499  {5000,0,'5'}, /* 5 ms */
5500  {6000,0,'6'}, /* 6 ms */
5501  {7000,0,'7'}, /* 7 ms */
5502  {8000,0,'8'}, /* 8 ms */
5503  {9000,0,'9'}, /* 9 ms */
5504  {10000,0,'A'}, /* 10 ms */
5505  {20000,0,'B'}, /* 20 ms */
5506  {30000,0,'C'}, /* 30 ms */
5507  {40000,0,'D'}, /* 40 ms */
5508  {50000,0,'E'}, /* 50 ms */
5509  {100000,0,'F'}, /* 0.1 s */
5510  {200000,0,'G'}, /* 0.2 s */
5511  {300000,0,'H'}, /* 0.3 s */
5512  {400000,0,'I'}, /* 0.4 s */
5513  {500000,0,'J'}, /* 0.5 s */
5514  {1000000,0,'K'}, /* 1 s */
5515  {2000000,0,'L'}, /* 2 s */
5516  {4000000,0,'M'}, /* 4 s */
5517  {8000000,0,'N'}, /* 8 s */
5518  {16000000,0,'O'}, /* 16 s */
5519  {30000000,0,'P'}, /* 30 s */
5520  {60000000,0,'Q'}, /* 1 minute */
5521  {0,0,'?'}, /* > 1 minute */
5522  };
5523 
5524  if (!context) exit(1);
5525  while(1) {
5526  start = ustime();
5527  reply = reconnectingRedisCommand(context,"PING");
5528  if (reply == NULL) {
5529  fprintf(stderr,"\nI/O error\n");
5530  exit(1);
5531  }
5532  latency = ustime()-start;
5533  freeReplyObject(reply);
5534  count++;
5535 
5536  /* Populate the relevant bucket. */
5537  for (j = 0; ; j++) {
5538  if (samples[j].max == 0 || latency <= samples[j].max) {
5539  samples[j].count++;
5540  break;
5541  }
5542  }
5543 
5544  /* From time to time show the spectrum. */
5545  if (count && (ustime()-history_start)/1000 > history_interval) {
5546  if ((outputs++ % 20) == 0)
5547  showLatencyDistLegend();
5548  showLatencyDistSamples(samples,count);
5549  history_start = ustime();
5550  count = 0;
5551  }
5552  usleep(LATENCY_SAMPLE_RATE * 1000);
5553  }
5554 }
5555 
5556 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5557  * Slave mode
5558  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5559 
5560 /* Sends SYNC and reads the number of bytes in the payload. Used both by
5561  * slaveMode() and getRDB(). */
5562 unsigned long long sendSync(int fd) {
5563  /* To start we need to send the SYNC command and return the payload.
5564  * The hiredis client lib does not understand this part of the protocol
5565  * and we don't want to mess with its buffers, so everything is performed
5566  * using direct low-level I/O. */
5567  char buf[4096], *p;
5568  ssize_t nread;
5569 
5570  /* Send the SYNC command. */
5571  if (write(fd,"SYNC\r\n",6) != 6) {
5572  fprintf(stderr,"Error writing to master\n");
5573  exit(1);
5574  }
5575 
5576  /* Read $<payload>\r\n, making sure to read just up to "\n" */
5577  p = buf;
5578  while(1) {
5579  nread = read(fd,p,1);
5580  if (nread <= 0) {
5581  fprintf(stderr,"Error reading bulk length while SYNCing\n");
5582  exit(1);
5583  }
5584  if (*p == '\n' && p != buf) break;
5585  if (*p != '\n') p++;
5586  }
5587  *p = '\0';
5588  if (buf[0] == '-') {
5589  printf("SYNC with master failed: %s\n", buf);
5590  exit(1);
5591  }
5592  return strtoull(buf+1,NULL,10);
5593 }
5594 
5595 static void slaveMode(void) {
5596  int fd = context->fd;
5597  unsigned long long payload = sendSync(fd);
5598  char buf[1024];
5599  int original_output = config.output;
5600 
5601  fprintf(stderr,"SYNC with master, discarding %llu "
5602  "bytes of bulk transfer...\n", payload);
5603 
5604  /* Discard the payload. */
5605  while(payload) {
5606  ssize_t nread;
5607 
5608  nread = read(fd,buf,(payload > sizeof(buf)) ? sizeof(buf) : payload);
5609  if (nread <= 0) {
5610  fprintf(stderr,"Error reading RDB payload while SYNCing\n");
5611  exit(1);
5612  }
5613  payload -= nread;
5614  }
5615  fprintf(stderr,"SYNC done. Logging commands from master.\n");
5616 
5617  /* Now we can use hiredis to read the incoming protocol. */
5618  config.output = OUTPUT_CSV;
5619  while (cliReadReply(0) == REDIS_OK);
5620  config.output = original_output;
5621 }
5622 
5623 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5624  * RDB transfer mode
5625  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5626 
5627 /* This function implements --rdb, so it uses the replication protocol in order
5628  * to fetch the RDB file from a remote server. */
5629 static void getRDB(void) {
5630  int s = context->fd;
5631  int fd;
5632  unsigned long long payload = sendSync(s);
5633  char buf[4096];
5634 
5635  fprintf(stderr,"SYNC sent to master, writing %llu bytes to '%s'\n",
5636  payload, config.rdb_filename);
5637 
5638  /* Write to file. */
5639  if (!strcmp(config.rdb_filename,"-")) {
5640  fd = STDOUT_FILENO;
5641  } else {
5642  fd = open(config.rdb_filename, O_CREAT|O_WRONLY, 0644);
5643  if (fd == -1) {
5644  fprintf(stderr, "Error opening '%s': %s\n", config.rdb_filename,
5645  strerror(errno));
5646  exit(1);
5647  }
5648  }
5649 
5650  while(payload) {
5651  ssize_t nread, nwritten;
5652 
5653  nread = read(s,buf,(payload > sizeof(buf)) ? sizeof(buf) : payload);
5654  if (nread <= 0) {
5655  fprintf(stderr,"I/O Error reading RDB payload from socket\n");
5656  exit(1);
5657  }
5658  nwritten = write(fd, buf, nread);
5659  if (nwritten != nread) {
5660  fprintf(stderr,"Error writing data to file: %s\n",
5661  (nwritten == -1) ? strerror(errno) : "short write");
5662  exit(1);
5663  }
5664  payload -= nread;
5665  }
5666  close(s); /* Close the file descriptor ASAP as fsync() may take time. */
5667  fsync(fd);
5668  close(fd);
5669  fprintf(stderr,"Transfer finished with success.\n");
5670  exit(0);
5671 }
5672 
5673 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5674  * Bulk import (pipe) mode
5675  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5676 
5677 #define PIPEMODE_WRITE_LOOP_MAX_BYTES (128*1024)
5678 static void pipeMode(void) {
5679  int fd = context->fd;
5680  long long errors = 0, replies = 0, obuf_len = 0, obuf_pos = 0;
5681  char ibuf[1024*16], obuf[1024*16]; /* Input and output buffers */
5682  char aneterr[ANET_ERR_LEN];
5683  redisReader *reader = redisReaderCreate();
5684  redisReply *reply;
5685  int eof = 0; /* True once we consumed all the standard input. */
5686  int done = 0;
5687  char magic[20]; /* Special reply we recognize. */
5688  time_t last_read_time = time(NULL);
5689 
5690  srand(time(NULL));
5691 
5692  /* Use non blocking I/O. */
5693  if (anetNonBlock(aneterr,fd) == ANET_ERR) {
5694  fprintf(stderr, "Can't set the socket in non blocking mode: %s\n",
5695  aneterr);
5696  exit(1);
5697  }
5698 
5699  /* Transfer raw protocol and read replies from the server at the same
5700  * time. */
5701  while(!done) {
5702  int mask = AE_READABLE;
5703 
5704  if (!eof || obuf_len != 0) mask |= AE_WRITABLE;
5705  mask = aeWait(fd,mask,1000);
5706 
5707  /* Handle the readable state: we can read replies from the server. */
5708  if (mask & AE_READABLE) {
5709  ssize_t nread;
5710 
5711  /* Read from socket and feed the hiredis reader. */
5712  do {
5713  nread = read(fd,ibuf,sizeof(ibuf));
5714  if (nread == -1 && errno != EAGAIN && errno != EINTR) {
5715  fprintf(stderr, "Error reading from the server: %s\n",
5716  strerror(errno));
5717  exit(1);
5718  }
5719  if (nread > 0) {
5720  redisReaderFeed(reader,ibuf,nread);
5721  last_read_time = time(NULL);
5722  }
5723  } while(nread > 0);
5724 
5725  /* Consume replies. */
5726  do {
5727  if (redisReaderGetReply(reader,(void**)&reply) == REDIS_ERR) {
5728  fprintf(stderr, "Error reading replies from server\n");
5729  exit(1);
5730  }
5731  if (reply) {
5732  if (reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
5733  fprintf(stderr,"%s\n", reply->str);
5734  errors++;
5735  } else if (eof && reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING &&
5736  reply->len == 20) {
5737  /* Check if this is the reply to our final ECHO
5738  * command. If so everything was received
5739  * from the server. */
5740  if (memcmp(reply->str,magic,20) == 0) {
5741  printf("Last reply received from server.\n");
5742  done = 1;
5743  replies--;
5744  }
5745  }
5746  replies++;
5747  freeReplyObject(reply);
5748  }
5749  } while(reply);
5750  }
5751 
5752  /* Handle the writable state: we can send protocol to the server. */
5753  if (mask & AE_WRITABLE) {
5754  ssize_t loop_nwritten = 0;
5755 
5756  while(1) {
5757  /* Transfer current buffer to server. */
5758  if (obuf_len != 0) {
5759  ssize_t nwritten = write(fd,obuf+obuf_pos,obuf_len);
5760 
5761  if (nwritten == -1) {
5762  if (errno != EAGAIN && errno != EINTR) {
5763  fprintf(stderr, "Error writing to the server: %s\n",
5764  strerror(errno));
5765  exit(1);
5766  } else {
5767  nwritten = 0;
5768  }
5769  }
5770  obuf_len -= nwritten;
5771  obuf_pos += nwritten;
5772  loop_nwritten += nwritten;
5773  if (obuf_len != 0) break; /* Can't accept more data. */
5774  }
5775  /* If buffer is empty, load from stdin. */
5776  if (obuf_len == 0 && !eof) {
5777  ssize_t nread = read(STDIN_FILENO,obuf,sizeof(obuf));
5778 
5779  if (nread == 0) {
5780  /* The ECHO sequence starts with a "\r\n" so that if there
5781  * is garbage in the protocol we read from stdin, the ECHO
5782  * will likely still be properly formatted.
5783  * CRLF is ignored by Redis, so it has no effects. */
5784  char echo[] =
5785  "\r\n*2\r\n$4\r\nECHO\r\n$20\r\n01234567890123456789\r\n";
5786  int j;
5787 
5788  eof = 1;
5789  /* Everything transferred, so we queue a special
5790  * ECHO command that we can match in the replies
5791  * to make sure everything was read from the server. */
5792  for (j = 0; j < 20; j++)
5793  magic[j] = rand() & 0xff;
5794  memcpy(echo+21,magic,20);
5795  memcpy(obuf,echo,sizeof(echo)-1);
5796  obuf_len = sizeof(echo)-1;
5797  obuf_pos = 0;
5798  printf("All data transferred. Waiting for the last reply...\n");
5799  } else if (nread == -1) {
5800  fprintf(stderr, "Error reading from stdin: %s\n",
5801  strerror(errno));
5802  exit(1);
5803  } else {
5804  obuf_len = nread;
5805  obuf_pos = 0;
5806  }
5807  }
5808  if ((obuf_len == 0 && eof) ||
5809  loop_nwritten > PIPEMODE_WRITE_LOOP_MAX_BYTES) break;
5810  }
5811  }
5812 
5813  /* Handle timeout, that is, we reached EOF, and we are not getting
5814  * replies from the server for a few seconds, nor the final ECHO is
5815  * received. */
5816  if (eof && config.pipe_timeout > 0 &&
5817  time(NULL)-last_read_time > config.pipe_timeout)
5818  {
5819  fprintf(stderr,"No replies for %d seconds: exiting.\n",
5820  config.pipe_timeout);
5821  errors++;
5822  break;
5823  }
5824  }
5825  redisReaderFree(reader);
5826  printf("errors: %lld, replies: %lld\n", errors, replies);
5827  if (errors)
5828  exit(1);
5829  else
5830  exit(0);
5831 }
5832 
5833 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5834  * Find big keys
5835  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5836 
5837 #define TYPE_STRING 0
5838 #define TYPE_LIST 1
5839 #define TYPE_SET 2
5840 #define TYPE_HASH 3
5841 #define TYPE_ZSET 4
5842 #define TYPE_STREAM 5
5843 #define TYPE_NONE 6
5844 #define TYPE_COUNT 7
5845 
5846 static redisReply *sendScan(unsigned long long *it) {
5847  redisReply *reply = redisCommand(context, "SCAN %llu", *it);
5848 
5849  /* Handle any error conditions */
5850  if(reply == NULL) {
5851  fprintf(stderr, "\nI/O error\n");
5852  exit(1);
5853  } else if(reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
5854  fprintf(stderr, "SCAN error: %s\n", reply->str);
5855  exit(1);
5856  } else if(reply->type != REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY) {
5857  fprintf(stderr, "Non ARRAY response from SCAN!\n");
5858  exit(1);
5859  } else if(reply->elements != 2) {
5860  fprintf(stderr, "Invalid element count from SCAN!\n");
5861  exit(1);
5862  }
5863 
5864  /* Validate our types are correct */
5865  assert(reply->element[0]->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING);
5866  assert(reply->element[1]->type == REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY);
5867 
5868  /* Update iterator */
5869  *it = strtoull(reply->element[0]->str, NULL, 10);
5870 
5871  return reply;
5872 }
5873 
5874 static int getDbSize(void) {
5875  redisReply *reply;
5876  int size;
5877 
5878  reply = redisCommand(context, "DBSIZE");
5879 
5880  if(reply == NULL || reply->type != REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER) {
5881  fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't determine DBSIZE!\n");
5882  exit(1);
5883  }
5884 
5885  /* Grab the number of keys and free our reply */
5886  size = reply->integer;
5887  freeReplyObject(reply);
5888 
5889  return size;
5890 }
5891 
5892 static int toIntType(char *key, char *type) {
5893  if(!strcmp(type, "string")) {
5894  return TYPE_STRING;
5895  } else if(!strcmp(type, "list")) {
5896  return TYPE_LIST;
5897  } else if(!strcmp(type, "set")) {
5898  return TYPE_SET;
5899  } else if(!strcmp(type, "hash")) {
5900  return TYPE_HASH;
5901  } else if(!strcmp(type, "zset")) {
5902  return TYPE_ZSET;
5903  } else if(!strcmp(type, "stream")) {
5904  return TYPE_STREAM;
5905  } else if(!strcmp(type, "none")) {
5906  return TYPE_NONE;
5907  } else {
5908  fprintf(stderr, "Unknown type '%s' for key '%s'\n", type, key);
5909  exit(1);
5910  }
5911 }
5912 
5913 static void getKeyTypes(redisReply *keys, int *types) {
5914  redisReply *reply;
5915  unsigned int i;
5916 
5917  /* Pipeline TYPE commands */
5918  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
5919  redisAppendCommand(context, "TYPE %s", keys->element[i]->str);
5920  }
5921 
5922  /* Retrieve types */
5923  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
5924  if(redisGetReply(context, (void**)&reply)!=REDIS_OK) {
5925  fprintf(stderr, "Error getting type for key '%s' (%d: %s)\n",
5926  keys->element[i]->str, context->err, context->errstr);
5927  exit(1);
5928  } else if(reply->type != REDIS_REPLY_STATUS) {
5929  if(reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
5930  fprintf(stderr, "TYPE returned an error: %s\n", reply->str);
5931  } else {
5932  fprintf(stderr,
5933  "Invalid reply type (%d) for TYPE on key '%s'!\n",
5934  reply->type, keys->element[i]->str);
5935  }
5936  exit(1);
5937  }
5938 
5939  types[i] = toIntType(keys->element[i]->str, reply->str);
5940  freeReplyObject(reply);
5941  }
5942 }
5943 
5944 static void getKeySizes(redisReply *keys, int *types,
5945  unsigned long long *sizes)
5946 {
5947  redisReply *reply;
5948  char *sizecmds[] = {"STRLEN","LLEN","SCARD","HLEN","ZCARD"};
5949  unsigned int i;
5950 
5951  /* Pipeline size commands */
5952  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
5953  /* Skip keys that were deleted */
5954  if(types[i]==TYPE_NONE)
5955  continue;
5956 
5957  redisAppendCommand(context, "%s %s", sizecmds[types[i]],
5958  keys->element[i]->str);
5959  }
5960 
5961  /* Retrieve sizes */
5962  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
5963  /* Skip keys that disappeared between SCAN and TYPE */
5964  if(types[i] == TYPE_NONE) {
5965  sizes[i] = 0;
5966  continue;
5967  }
5968 
5969  /* Retrieve size */
5970  if(redisGetReply(context, (void**)&reply)!=REDIS_OK) {
5971  fprintf(stderr, "Error getting size for key '%s' (%d: %s)\n",
5972  keys->element[i]->str, context->err, context->errstr);
5973  exit(1);
5974  } else if(reply->type != REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER) {
5975  /* Theoretically the key could have been removed and
5976  * added as a different type between TYPE and SIZE */
5977  fprintf(stderr,
5978  "Warning: %s on '%s' failed (may have changed type)\n",
5979  sizecmds[types[i]], keys->element[i]->str);
5980  sizes[i] = 0;
5981  } else {
5982  sizes[i] = reply->integer;
5983  }
5984 
5985  freeReplyObject(reply);
5986  }
5987 }
5988 
5989 static void findBigKeys(void) {
5990  unsigned long long biggest[TYPE_COUNT] = {0}, counts[TYPE_COUNT] = {0}, totalsize[TYPE_COUNT] = {0};
5991  unsigned long long sampled = 0, total_keys, totlen=0, *sizes=NULL, it=0;
5992  sds maxkeys[TYPE_COUNT] = {0};
5993  char *typename[] = {"string","list","set","hash","zset","stream","none"};
5994  char *typeunit[] = {"bytes","items","members","fields","members","entries",""};
5995  redisReply *reply, *keys;
5996  unsigned int arrsize=0, i;
5997  int type, *types=NULL;
5998  double pct;
5999 
6000  /* Total keys pre scanning */
6001  total_keys = getDbSize();
6002 
6003  /* Status message */
6004  printf("\n# Scanning the entire keyspace to find biggest keys as well as\n");
6005  printf("# average sizes per key type. You can use -i 0.1 to sleep 0.1 sec\n");
6006  printf("# per 100 SCAN commands (not usually needed).\n\n");
6007 
6008  /* New up sds strings to keep track of overall biggest per type */
6009  for(i=0;i<TYPE_NONE; i++) {
6010  maxkeys[i] = sdsempty();
6011  if(!maxkeys[i]) {
6012  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to allocate memory for largest key names!\n");
6013  exit(1);
6014  }
6015  }
6016 
6017  /* SCAN loop */
6018  do {
6019  /* Calculate approximate percentage completion */
6020  pct = 100 * (double)sampled/total_keys;
6021 
6022  /* Grab some keys and point to the keys array */
6023  reply = sendScan(&it);
6024  keys = reply->element[1];
6025 
6026  /* Reallocate our type and size array if we need to */
6027  if(keys->elements > arrsize) {
6028  types = zrealloc(types, sizeof(int)*keys->elements);
6029  sizes = zrealloc(sizes, sizeof(unsigned long long)*keys->elements);
6030 
6031  if(!types || !sizes) {
6032  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to allocate storage for keys!\n");
6033  exit(1);
6034  }
6035 
6036  arrsize = keys->elements;
6037  }
6038 
6039  /* Retrieve types and then sizes */
6040  getKeyTypes(keys, types);
6041  getKeySizes(keys, types, sizes);
6042 
6043  /* Now update our stats */
6044  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
6045  if((type = types[i]) == TYPE_NONE)
6046  continue;
6047 
6048  totalsize[type] += sizes[i];
6049  counts[type]++;
6050  totlen += keys->element[i]->len;
6051  sampled++;
6052 
6053  if(biggest[type]<sizes[i]) {
6054  printf(
6055  "[%05.2f%%] Biggest %-6s found so far '%s' with %llu %s\n",
6056  pct, typename[type], keys->element[i]->str, sizes[i],
6057  typeunit[type]);
6058 
6059  /* Keep track of biggest key name for this type */
6060  maxkeys[type] = sdscpy(maxkeys[type], keys->element[i]->str);
6061  if(!maxkeys[type]) {
6062  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to allocate memory for key!\n");
6063  exit(1);
6064  }
6065 
6066  /* Keep track of the biggest size for this type */
6067  biggest[type] = sizes[i];
6068  }
6069 
6070  /* Update overall progress */
6071  if(sampled % 1000000 == 0) {
6072  printf("[%05.2f%%] Sampled %llu keys so far\n", pct, sampled);
6073  }
6074  }
6075 
6076  /* Sleep if we've been directed to do so */
6077  if(sampled && (sampled %100) == 0 && config.interval) {
6078  usleep(config.interval);
6079  }
6080 
6081  freeReplyObject(reply);
6082  } while(it != 0);
6083 
6084  if(types) zfree(types);
6085  if(sizes) zfree(sizes);
6086 
6087  /* We're done */
6088  printf("\n-------- summary -------\n\n");
6089 
6090  printf("Sampled %llu keys in the keyspace!\n", sampled);
6091  printf("Total key length in bytes is %llu (avg len %.2f)\n\n",
6092  totlen, totlen ? (double)totlen/sampled : 0);
6093 
6094  /* Output the biggest keys we found, for types we did find */
6095  for(i=0;i<TYPE_NONE;i++) {
6096  if(sdslen(maxkeys[i])>0) {
6097  printf("Biggest %6s found '%s' has %llu %s\n", typename[i], maxkeys[i],
6098  biggest[i], typeunit[i]);
6099  }
6100  }
6101 
6102  printf("\n");
6103 
6104  for(i=0;i<TYPE_NONE;i++) {
6105  printf("%llu %ss with %llu %s (%05.2f%% of keys, avg size %.2f)\n",
6106  counts[i], typename[i], totalsize[i], typeunit[i],
6107  sampled ? 100 * (double)counts[i]/sampled : 0,
6108  counts[i] ? (double)totalsize[i]/counts[i] : 0);
6109  }
6110 
6111  /* Free sds strings containing max keys */
6112  for(i=0;i<TYPE_NONE;i++) {
6113  sdsfree(maxkeys[i]);
6114  }
6115 
6116  /* Success! */
6117  exit(0);
6118 }
6119 
6120 static void getKeyFreqs(redisReply *keys, unsigned long long *freqs) {
6121  redisReply *reply;
6122  unsigned int i;
6123 
6124  /* Pipeline OBJECT freq commands */
6125  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
6126  redisAppendCommand(context, "OBJECT freq %s", keys->element[i]->str);
6127  }
6128 
6129  /* Retrieve freqs */
6130  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
6131  if(redisGetReply(context, (void**)&reply)!=REDIS_OK) {
6132  fprintf(stderr, "Error getting freq for key '%s' (%d: %s)\n",
6133  keys->element[i]->str, context->err, context->errstr);
6134  exit(1);
6135  } else if(reply->type != REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER) {
6136  if(reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
6137  fprintf(stderr, "Error: %s\n", reply->str);
6138  exit(1);
6139  } else {
6140  fprintf(stderr, "Warning: OBJECT freq on '%s' failed (may have been deleted)\n", keys->element[i]->str);
6141  freqs[i] = 0;
6142  }
6143  } else {
6144  freqs[i] = reply->integer;
6145  }
6146  freeReplyObject(reply);
6147  }
6148 }
6149 
6150 #define HOTKEYS_SAMPLE 16
6151 static void findHotKeys(void) {
6152  redisReply *keys, *reply;
6153  unsigned long long counters[HOTKEYS_SAMPLE] = {0};
6154  sds hotkeys[HOTKEYS_SAMPLE] = {NULL};
6155  unsigned long long sampled = 0, total_keys, *freqs = NULL, it = 0;
6156  unsigned int arrsize = 0, i, k;
6157  double pct;
6158 
6159  /* Total keys pre scanning */
6160  total_keys = getDbSize();
6161 
6162  /* Status message */
6163  printf("\n# Scanning the entire keyspace to find hot keys as well as\n");
6164  printf("# average sizes per key type. You can use -i 0.1 to sleep 0.1 sec\n");
6165  printf("# per 100 SCAN commands (not usually needed).\n\n");
6166 
6167  /* SCAN loop */
6168  do {
6169  /* Calculate approximate percentage completion */
6170  pct = 100 * (double)sampled/total_keys;
6171 
6172  /* Grab some keys and point to the keys array */
6173  reply = sendScan(&it);
6174  keys = reply->element[1];
6175 
6176  /* Reallocate our freqs array if we need to */
6177  if(keys->elements > arrsize) {
6178  freqs = zrealloc(freqs, sizeof(unsigned long long)*keys->elements);
6179 
6180  if(!freqs) {
6181  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to allocate storage for keys!\n");
6182  exit(1);
6183  }
6184 
6185  arrsize = keys->elements;
6186  }
6187 
6188  getKeyFreqs(keys, freqs);
6189 
6190  /* Now update our stats */
6191  for(i=0;i<keys->elements;i++) {
6192  sampled++;
6193  /* Update overall progress */
6194  if(sampled % 1000000 == 0) {
6195  printf("[%05.2f%%] Sampled %llu keys so far\n", pct, sampled);
6196  }
6197 
6198  /* Use eviction pool here */
6199  k = 0;
6200  while (k < HOTKEYS_SAMPLE && freqs[i] > counters[k]) k++;
6201  if (k == 0) continue;
6202  k--;
6203  if (k == 0 || counters[k] == 0) {
6204  sdsfree(hotkeys[k]);
6205  } else {
6206  sdsfree(hotkeys[0]);
6207  memmove(counters,counters+1,sizeof(counters[0])*k);
6208  memmove(hotkeys,hotkeys+1,sizeof(hotkeys[0])*k);
6209  }
6210  counters[k] = freqs[i];
6211  hotkeys[k] = sdsnew(keys->element[i]->str);
6212  printf(
6213  "[%05.2f%%] Hot key '%s' found so far with counter %llu\n",
6214  pct, keys->element[i]->str, freqs[i]);
6215  }
6216 
6217  /* Sleep if we've been directed to do so */
6218  if(sampled && (sampled %100) == 0 && config.interval) {
6219  usleep(config.interval);
6220  }
6221 
6222  freeReplyObject(reply);
6223  } while(it != 0);
6224 
6225  if (freqs) zfree(freqs);
6226 
6227  /* We're done */
6228  printf("\n-------- summary -------\n\n");
6229 
6230  printf("Sampled %llu keys in the keyspace!\n", sampled);
6231 
6232  for (i=1; i<= HOTKEYS_SAMPLE; i++) {
6233  k = HOTKEYS_SAMPLE - i;
6234  if(counters[k]>0) {
6235  printf("hot key found with counter: %llu\tkeyname: %s\n", counters[k], hotkeys[k]);
6236  sdsfree(hotkeys[k]);
6237  }
6238  }
6239 
6240  exit(0);
6241 }

6243 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6244  * Stats mode
6245  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6246 
6247 /* Return the specified INFO field from the INFO command output "info".
6248  * A new buffer is allocated for the result, that needs to be free'd.
6249  * If the field is not found NULL is returned. */
6250 static char *getInfoField(char *info, char *field) {
6251  char *p = strstr(info,field);
6252  char *n1, *n2;
6253  char *result;
6254 
6255  if (!p) return NULL;
6256  p += strlen(field)+1;
6257  n1 = strchr(p,'\r');
6258  n2 = strchr(p,',');
6259  if (n2 && n2 < n1) n1 = n2;
6260  result = zmalloc(sizeof(char)*(n1-p)+1);
6261  memcpy(result,p,(n1-p));
6262  result[n1-p] = '\0';
6263  return result;
6264 }
6265 
6266 /* Like the above function but automatically convert the result into
6267  * a long. On error (missing field) LONG_MIN is returned. */
6268 static long getLongInfoField(char *info, char *field) {
6269  char *value = getInfoField(info,field);
6270  long l;
6271 
6272  if (!value) return LONG_MIN;
6273  l = strtol(value,NULL,10);
6274  zfree(value);
6275  return l;
6276 }
6277 
6278 /* Convert number of bytes into a human readable string of the form:
6279  * 100B, 2G, 100M, 4K, and so forth. */
6280 void bytesToHuman(char *s, long long n) {
6281  double d;
6282 
6283  if (n < 0) {
6284  *s = '-';
6285  s++;
6286  n = -n;
6287  }
6288  if (n < 1024) {
6289  /* Bytes */
6290  sprintf(s,"%lldB",n);
6291  return;
6292  } else if (n < (1024*1024)) {
6293  d = (double)n/(1024);
6294  sprintf(s,"%.2fK",d);
6295  } else if (n < (1024LL*1024*1024)) {
6296  d = (double)n/(1024*1024);
6297  sprintf(s,"%.2fM",d);
6298  } else if (n < (1024LL*1024*1024*1024)) {
6299  d = (double)n/(1024LL*1024*1024);
6300  sprintf(s,"%.2fG",d);
6301  }
6302 }
6303 
6304 static void statMode(void) {
6305  redisReply *reply;
6306  long aux, requests = 0;
6307  int i = 0;
6308 
6309  while(1) {
6310  char buf[64];
6311  int j;
6312 
6313  reply = reconnectingRedisCommand(context,"INFO");
6314  if (reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
6315  printf("ERROR: %s\n", reply->str);
6316  exit(1);
6317  }
6318 
6319  if ((i++ % 20) == 0) {
6320  printf(
6321 "------- data ------ --------------------- load -------------------- - child -\n"
6322 "keys mem clients blocked requests connections \n");
6323  }
6324 
6325  /* Keys */
6326  aux = 0;
6327  for (j = 0; j < 20; j++) {
6328  long k;
6329 
6330  sprintf(buf,"db%d:keys",j);
6331  k = getLongInfoField(reply->str,buf);
6332  if (k == LONG_MIN) continue;
6333  aux += k;
6334  }
6335  sprintf(buf,"%ld",aux);
6336  printf("%-11s",buf);
6337 
6338  /* Used memory */
6339  aux = getLongInfoField(reply->str,"used_memory");
6340  bytesToHuman(buf,aux);
6341  printf("%-8s",buf);
6342 
6343  /* Clients */
6344  aux = getLongInfoField(reply->str,"connected_clients");
6345  sprintf(buf,"%ld",aux);
6346  printf(" %-8s",buf);
6347 
6348  /* Blocked (BLPOPPING) Clients */
6349  aux = getLongInfoField(reply->str,"blocked_clients");
6350  sprintf(buf,"%ld",aux);
6351  printf("%-8s",buf);
6352 
6353  /* Requests */
6354  aux = getLongInfoField(reply->str,"total_commands_processed");
6355  sprintf(buf,"%ld (+%ld)",aux,requests == 0 ? 0 : aux-requests);
6356  printf("%-19s",buf);
6357  requests = aux;
6358 
6359  /* Connections */
6360  aux = getLongInfoField(reply->str,"total_connections_received");
6361  sprintf(buf,"%ld",aux);
6362  printf(" %-12s",buf);
6363 
6364  /* Children */
6365  aux = getLongInfoField(reply->str,"bgsave_in_progress");
6366  aux |= getLongInfoField(reply->str,"aof_rewrite_in_progress") << 1;
6367  aux |= getLongInfoField(reply->str,"loading") << 2;
6368  switch(aux) {
6369  case 0: break;
6370  case 1:
6371  printf("SAVE");
6372  break;
6373  case 2:
6374  printf("AOF");
6375  break;
6376  case 3:
6377  printf("SAVE+AOF");
6378  break;
6379  case 4:
6380  printf("LOAD");
6381  break;
6382  }
6383 
6384  printf("\n");
6385  freeReplyObject(reply);
6386  usleep(config.interval);
6387  }
6388 }
6389 
6390 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6391  * Scan mode
6392  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6393 
6394 static void scanMode(void) {
6395  redisReply *reply;
6396  unsigned long long cur = 0;
6397 
6398  do {
6399  if (config.pattern)
6400  reply = redisCommand(context,"SCAN %llu MATCH %s",
6401  cur,config.pattern);
6402  else
6403  reply = redisCommand(context,"SCAN %llu",cur);
6404  if (reply == NULL) {
6405  printf("I/O error\n");
6406  exit(1);
6407  } else if (reply->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
6408  printf("ERROR: %s\n", reply->str);
6409  exit(1);
6410  } else {
6411  unsigned int j;
6412 
6413  cur = strtoull(reply->element[0]->str,NULL,10);
6414  for (j = 0; j < reply->element[1]->elements; j++)
6415  printf("%s\n", reply->element[1]->element[j]->str);
6416  }
6417  freeReplyObject(reply);
6418  } while(cur != 0);
6419 
6420  exit(0);
6421 }
6422 
6423 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6424  * LRU test mode
6425  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6426 
6427 /* Return an integer from min to max (both inclusive) using a power-law
6428  * distribution, depending on the value of alpha: the greater the alpha
6429  * the more bias towards lower values.
6430  *
6431  * With alpha = 6.2 the output follows the 80-20 rule where 20% of
6432  * the returned numbers will account for 80% of the frequency. */
6433 long long powerLawRand(long long min, long long max, double alpha) {
6434  double pl, r;
6435 
6436  max += 1;
6437  r = ((double)rand()) / RAND_MAX;
6438  pl = pow(
6439  ((pow(max,alpha+1) - pow(min,alpha+1))*r + pow(min,alpha+1)),
6440  (1.0/(alpha+1)));
6441  return (max-1-(long long)pl)+min;
6442 }
6443 
6444 /* Generates a key name among a set of lru_test_sample_size keys, using
6445  * an 80-20 distribution. */
6446 void LRUTestGenKey(char *buf, size_t buflen) {
6447  snprintf(buf, buflen, "lru:%lld",
6448  powerLawRand(1, config.lru_test_sample_size, 6.2));
6449 }
6450 
6451 #define LRU_CYCLE_PERIOD 1000 /* 1000 milliseconds. */
6452 #define LRU_CYCLE_PIPELINE_SIZE 250
6453 static void LRUTestMode(void) {
6454  redisReply *reply;
6455  char key[128];
6456  long long start_cycle;
6457  int j;
6458 
6459  srand(time(NULL)^getpid());
6460  while(1) {
6461  /* Perform cycles of 1 second with 50% writes and 50% reads.
6462  * We use pipelining batching writes / reads N times per cycle in order
6463  * to fill the target instance easily. */
6464  start_cycle = mstime();
6465  long long hits = 0, misses = 0;
6466  while(mstime() - start_cycle < 1000) {
6467  /* Write cycle. */
6468  for (j = 0; j < LRU_CYCLE_PIPELINE_SIZE; j++) {
6469  char val[6];
6470  val[5] = '\0';
6471  for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) val[i] = 'A'+rand()%('z'-'A');
6472  LRUTestGenKey(key,sizeof(key));
6473  redisAppendCommand(context, "SET %s %s",key,val);
6474  }
6475  for (j = 0; j < LRU_CYCLE_PIPELINE_SIZE; j++)
6476  redisGetReply(context, (void**)&reply);
6477 
6478  /* Read cycle. */
6479  for (j = 0; j < LRU_CYCLE_PIPELINE_SIZE; j++) {
6480  LRUTestGenKey(key,sizeof(key));
6481  redisAppendCommand(context, "GET %s",key);
6482  }
6483  for (j = 0; j < LRU_CYCLE_PIPELINE_SIZE; j++) {
6484  if (redisGetReply(context, (void**)&reply) == REDIS_OK) {
6485  switch(reply->type) {
6486  case REDIS_REPLY_ERROR:
6487  printf("%s\n", reply->str);
6488  break;
6489  case REDIS_REPLY_NIL:
6490  misses++;
6491  break;
6492  default:
6493  hits++;
6494  break;
6495  }
6496  }
6497  }
6498 
6499  if (context->err) {
6500  fprintf(stderr,"I/O error during LRU test\n");
6501  exit(1);
6502  }
6503  }
6504  /* Print stats. */
6505  printf(
6506  "%lld Gets/sec | Hits: %lld (%.2f%%) | Misses: %lld (%.2f%%)\n",
6507  hits+misses,
6508  hits, (double)hits/(hits+misses)*100,
6509  misses, (double)misses/(hits+misses)*100);
6510  }
6511  exit(0);
6512 }
6513 
6514 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6515  * Intrisic latency mode.
6516  *
6517  * Measure max latency of a running process that does not result from
6518  * syscalls. Basically this software should provide an hint about how much
6519  * time the kernel leaves the process without a chance to run.
6520  *--------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
6521 
6522 /* This is just some computation the compiler can't optimize out.
6523  * Should run in less than 100-200 microseconds even using very
6524  * slow hardware. Runs in less than 10 microseconds in modern HW. */
6525 unsigned long compute_something_fast(void) {
6526  unsigned char s[256], i, j, t;
6527  int count = 1000, k;
6528  unsigned long output = 0;
6529 
6530  for (k = 0; k < 256; k++) s[k] = k;
6531 
6532  i = 0;
6533  j = 0;
6534  while(count--) {
6535  i++;
6536  j = j + s[i];
6537  t = s[i];
6538  s[i] = s[j];
6539  s[j] = t;
6540  output += s[(s[i]+s[j])&255];
6541  }
6542  return output;
6543 }
6544 
6545 static void intrinsicLatencyModeStop(int s) {
6546  UNUSED(s);
6547  force_cancel_loop = 1;
6548 }
6549 
6550 static void intrinsicLatencyMode(void) {
6551  long long test_end, run_time, max_latency = 0, runs = 0;
6552 
6553  run_time = config.intrinsic_latency_duration*1000000;
6554  test_end = ustime() + run_time;
6555  signal(SIGINT, intrinsicLatencyModeStop);
6556 
6557  while(1) {
6558  long long start, end, latency;
6559 
6560  start = ustime();
6561  compute_something_fast();
6562  end = ustime();
6563  latency = end-start;
6564  runs++;
6565  if (latency <= 0) continue;
6566 
6567  /* Reporting */
6568  if (latency > max_latency) {
6569  max_latency = latency;
6570  printf("Max latency so far: %lld microseconds.\n", max_latency);
6571  }
6572 
6573  double avg_us = (double)run_time/runs;
6574  double avg_ns = avg_us * 1e3;
6575  if (force_cancel_loop || end > test_end) {
6576  printf("\n%lld total runs "
6577  "(avg latency: "
6578  "%.4f microseconds / %.2f nanoseconds per run).\n",
6579  runs, avg_us, avg_ns);
6580  printf("Worst run took %.0fx longer than the average latency.\n",
6581  max_latency / avg_us);
6582  exit(0);
6583  }
6584  }
6585 }

6738  signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);

6741  * A new attempt will be performed for every command send. */
6742  cliConnect(0);
6743  repl();
6744  }
6745 
6746  /* Otherwise, we have some arguments to execute */
6747  if (cliConnect(0) != REDIS_OK) exit(1);
6748  if (config.eval) {
6749  return evalMode(argc,argv);
6750  } else {
6751  return noninteractive(argc,convertToSds(argc,argv));
6752  }
6753 }
